title: Fact Check: Old image of mob attack victim painted in Love-Jihad hues
content: An image showing a Hindu woman with injury marks on her face is viral on social media with the claim that she was subjected to domestic violence by her Muslim husband.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did burqa replace Khaki for an IPS officer in Maharashtra?
content: A picture of a girl in hijab seated behind a desk and surrounded by men in uniform, with a Maharashtra Police board behind, is circulating on social media with the claim that the first Muslim woman IPS officer from Urdu medium joined office in a burqa, thus violating the force’s dress code.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: The curious case of a 'desecrated' Kali idol in a Bengal temple
content: Several pictures of a burnt idol of Goddess Kali are circulating on social media with the claim that hooligans from the Muslim community were behind the act in West Bengal's Murshidabad district.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens walk down the aisle of communal hatred over Pak child marriage
content: A picture of a minor girl in bridal wear sitting beside a middle-aged man has gone viral on social media with communally-charged claims.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Egypt pipeline fire goes viral as scenes from Sweden riots
content: Video of thick plumes of smoke billowing from a massive fire is circulating on social media with accompanying claims giving an impression that this is what Muslims did during the riots in Sweden. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the post to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Muslims in Switzerland demand removal of Swiss cross from the flag?
content: Amid riots in Sweden, an image purportedly showing Muslim refugees in Switzerland burning the Swiss flag went viral on social media with the claim that the men were demanding the cross be removed from the Swiss flag.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Afzal Guru at peace over Pranab’s death? That’s a fake Rana Ayyub tweet
content: According to a screenshot circulating on social media, journalist Rana Ayyub has tweeted that “martyr” Afzal Guru will now feel at peace after the demise of former President Pranab Mukherjee who’d rejected his mercy plea.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this Chennai cop was not beaten by Muslim men
content: A picture of a car burning on the roadside is circulating on social media linking it to the recent violence in Norway.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Scene of arson at 'Black Lives Matter' protest goes viral as Norway riots
content: A picture of a car burning on the roadside is circulating on social media linking it to the recent violence in Norway.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: These women were not injured in the Sweden riots
content: Amid violence in Swedish city of Malmo, a collage of 16 pictures showing badly injured faces of some women are circulating on Twitter with the claim that this is what the immigrants did to Swedish women during the riots. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the women’s mugshots are not related to the Sweden riots.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video of Muslims chanting 'Islam Zindabad' is not from Kolkata
content: A Bengali song including the words "Islam Zindabad" can be heard playing in the background of the viral video.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, the man PM Modi is paying homage to is not Nathuram Godse
content: A photo collage of Prime Minister Narendra Modi went viral on social media with the claim that he was paying respect to Mahatma Gandhi as well as his assassin Nathuram Godse. However, India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is false.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Zuckerberg never said this about the 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan
content: Many social media users are sharing a picture collage of Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Lord Ram with the claim that he has said: "Each and every day at least 200 crore "Jai Shri Ram" are written on Facebook Let's add a few more thousands here please. Jai Shri Ram Jai Shri Ram Jai Shri Ram!!"
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Following a hoax about exam dates, CLAT now indeed postponed to September 28
content: A viral claim on social media says the Common Law Admission Test (CLAT), which is supposed to be held on September 7, has been postponed.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Who was this 'terrorist' captured at a Karnataka bus stand?
content: A video of a man, his face covered and hands behind his head, kneeling as he is surrounded by policemen pointing guns at him, is viral on social media. It is being claimed that a terrorist was captured at Hubli bus stand in Karnataka and the entire action was captured on camera.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No love jihad angle in acid attack on aspiring model
content: On social media, a collage of two images — one of a woman, and the other showing her burnt and disfigured face — is going viral, with accompanying claims hinting that she is a Hindu girl who was attacked by her Muslim lover. However, the girl seen in the viral picture is a Muslim, who was attacked by a white man in London in 2017.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Unmasking misleading claims around Kamala's US presidential poll campaign
content: Social media users posted pictures of US presidential nominee Joe Biden and his running mate Kamala Harris suggesting that they did not wear face masks despite Covid-19 guidelines.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Don’t slip over this Rasbhari gossip with a Pak twist
content: The woman in the photo is an Indian model. Also, no such incident was reported by credible sources from Pakistan.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens warn of asteroid hit a day before US elections
content: Netizens have raised alarm over another “catastrophe” at the end of the year – this time it’s celestial.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens bake confusion over Tricolour cake, accuse Ankhi Das of insulting India
content: Two pictures showing a lady cutting a Tricolour cake have gone viral on social media with the claim that Ankhi Das has disrespected the country by such an act.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Gurugram flyover comes crashing down on social media with misleading claims
content: Some social media users have shared the same pictures with the claim that it is from Mumbai or Ahmedabad.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Aamir Khan meet Pakistani terrorists? Here is the truth
content: A picture of Aamir Khan with two bearded men is doing rounds on social media with the claim that he met Pakistani terrorists during his Hajj visit.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of Bengal violence passed off as Bengaluru riots
content: A video of violent clashes between a mob and police is circulating on social media with the claim that it is a scene from the riots that took place in Bengaluru on August 11, 2020.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is pollution control certificate mandatory for motor insurance claim?
content: In what reportedly created panic among citizens in the country, a viral claim on social media says that if the validity of a vehicle’s pollution under control (PUC) certificate is expired during the time of an accident, the insurance firms will not cover any damages.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory claims Sushant was killed for a corona testing patent
content: Actor Neeta Mohindra, who played Sushant Singh Rajput's mother in the Dhoni biopic, recently said the late actor had developed an app which could detect Covid-19 infection just through a person's breathing.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: How a fight between two Hindu groups in Hyderabad took a communal spin on social media
content: A video of a group of men from Hyderabad squabbling next to a Ganesha idol went viral on the internet. The video claims that it showed how Hindus were prevented from installing a Ganesh idol by anti-Hindu goons.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Sushant's death gets a Dawood link on social media
content: On Facebook, a picture of Padukone, her husband and actor Ranveer Singh, and Rajput's friend and filmmaker Sandip Ssingh -- late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's friend -- along with two other men, is going viral. The group is seen sitting around a table full of food items. Netizens claim one of the men is fugitive underworld don Dawood Ibrahim.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Created in 1962, did this illustration predict the pandemic in 2020?
content: People are looking at the illustration as the artist's premonition drawn 58 years ago on social distancing measures required during the Covid-19 pandemic.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of sewage-filled dug up road from Delhi goes viral as that from Varanasi
content: Varanasi was found to be the cleanest among cities along the river Ganges in the Sanitation Ranking list of the Swachh Survekshan 2020 held in over 4,000 cities and towns in the country. However, an image of a road dug up and filled with sewage water is viral on social media with the claim that it is from Varanasi.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: VFX video created by Russian artist wrongly circulated as protest scene in Belarus
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is not real. It is a computer graphics made using visual effects software.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Mt Fuji lights up on Internet with digital fireworks and an Olympic twist
content: An old video showing colourful and beautifully synchronised fireworks in Tokyo is going viral with a claim that Japan was forced to use the fireworks it bought for the Olympics after the event was postponed.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Here's truth behind viral story of incestuous marriage between son and his mother
content: Photos of a couple had gone viral on social media with claims of an incest story about a mother and son duo who purportedly got married to each other. India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) found the couple to be the latest victim of online bullying and harassment.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did BJP MP from Kerala conduct his mother's funeral without revealing she died of Covid-19?
content: Netizens are sharing local media reports from Kerala which claims that BJP MP and former Union Minister Alphons Kannanthanam allegedly sent his mother's dead body from Delhi to Kerala for the funeral without revealing she died of Covid-19.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image from Bangladesh falsely circulated as that depicting miserable life in Indian slums
content: A photograph showing children living inside four-ft diameter sewage pipes is viral on social media with the claim that it is a scene that shows the deplorable living conditions of Indian children in a slum. Netizens are criticising the viral photograph along with the government for its lack of focus on homeless children.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Has Russia gifted 1 million doses of Covid vaccine to Pakistan?
content: As per the Russian website created for updates on the Covid vaccine, “Spuknik V”, the mass production of the vaccine is expected to start in September 2020.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Kashmir witness stone-pelting like this viral post claims?
content: A picture of what appears to be of a clash between security forces and protesters has gone viral on social media with the claim that stone-pelting started in Kreeri after the killing of three militants in the Baramulla encounter on Monday.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Israel may still be pounding bombs over Gaza, but this massive blast is not recent
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room found that the claim that is being made in the viral picture is untrue. Though Israel has been conducting airstrikes on Gaza recently, the viral picture being shared in this context is one-year-old and not of the recent airstrikes.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Did National Security Advisor use Egyptian national flag in his I-Day wish to India?
content: A screenshot of an Independence Day message with an Egyptian national flag purportedly posted on the Facebook page of NSA Ajit Doval is being circulated on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens fall prey to British PM Boris Johnson's imposter account offering apology for colonial rule in India
content: The viral tweet by a fake account of Boris Johnson says, "I am sorry for what Britain did to India 74 years ago, so I want to apologize to Indians. Happy Independence Day to Incredible India."
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not King of Bahrain arriving in Dubai with his automaton bodyguard
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim is misleading. The man in the video is not the King of Bahrain and the robot is not his bodyguard.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Burj Khalifa light up with Israeli flag after the historic pact with UAE?
content: After the landmark accord between the UAE and Israel, an image of Burj Khalifa in Dubai has gone viral with the claim that the world's tallest building lit up in the colours of the Israeli flag.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not an RSS man held for waving Pakistani flag in burqa
content: A video of a man removing his burqa in front of policemen has gone viral on social media with the claim that he is an RSS man who was caught waving the Pakistani flag in a burqa to defame Muslims.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: US Army band playing Indian National Anthem goes viral with misleading claims
content: India celebrated its 74th Independence Day on August 15, 2020. Amid the muted celebrations across the country, a video of an American Army band purportedly playing 'Jana Gana Mana' on August 15, 2020, as a display of honour to India is viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral image showing Tricolour unfurled at Srinagar’s Lal Chowk at I-Day 2020 is morphed
content: An image of Srinagar’s nerve centre, Lal Chowk is viral on social media with the Indian national flag flying atop its clock tower. India Today's AFWA finds the truth.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Image from Nepal falsely circulated as Uttarakhand children going to school using wire bridge
content: An image of a group of school kids swinging a cable bridge on their own to reach school is circulating online with the claim that it is from the state of Uttarakhand.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind the image of Jesus inside sanctum sanctorum of a Ganapathy temple in Karnataka
content: An image with the photo of Jesus inside the sanctum sanctorum of a Ganapathy temple in Chamarajanagar is viral on the internet with the claim that the district SP, who is from the Christian faith pressured the priest to place the photo of Jesus inside the temple. The viral image also shows SP Divya Sara Thomas worshipping in front of the sanctum sanctorum.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact check: This is not Bhagat Singh getting flogged in the viral image
content: The man seen in the picture getting flogged was not freedom fighter Bhagat Singh. This picture was taken at Kasur railway station (now in Pakistan) around 1919. Singh was only 12 then and was studying at D.A.V school in Lahore.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Image from 2016 Cauvery riots falsely circulated as that from recent Bengaluru violence
content: The image of a truck set on fire is from the 2016 Cauvery riots in Bengaluru and has nothing to do with August 11 violence in the Pulikeshi Nagar area of the city.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Temple showcasing unity among religions faces social media fury
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture is indeed of a Ganesh temple in Bengaluru’s Thyagaraja Nagar, but its gopuram has had the Jesus Christ idol for over 40 years. A gopuram is the entrance tower to a Hindu temple.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Is the Russian Covid-19 vaccine a syringe full of hot air?
content: Russia's Covid vaccine‘Sputnik V’ has been named after the world’s first satellite but it has failed to establish itself firmly in the orbit of scientific Illuminati.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: New Zealand PM’s temple visit goes viral with misleading claim
content: Viral posts on social media are claiming New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern visited a Hindu temple after declaring her country free of coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This picture showing the plight of patients is not from Kashmir
content: A picture showing patient lying on bed and holding glucose drip by his feet has gone viral with the claim that this is the pathetic condition of government hospitals in Kashmir.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Image showing sea of saffron flags has no link with Ayodhya Bhoomi Pujan
content: An image of a large rally with saffron flags is viral on social media with the claim that the crowd is from Ayodhya on the day of Ram Temple’s groundbreaking ceremony.  India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim is misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Horrific video of billboard falling on two motorcyclists is not from Hyderabad
content: A horrific video showing a billboard falling on two motorcyclists on a road has gone viral on social media with the claim that the incident took place at Mehdipatnam flyover in Hyderabad.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of Pakistani protestors uprooting saplings go viral with a radical Islamic spin
content: A video from Pakistan showing a large group of people including children uprooting the newly planted trees is viral on social media with a claim that “planting trees is against Islam".
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Bihar cop probing SSR's death and quarantined in Mumbai isn't with CBI now
content: Several users on Twitter and Facebook have made the claim that Vinay Tiwari, the IPS officer from Bihar who was sent to Mumbai to probe Sushant Singh Rajput's death, has been deputed to the CBI for investigation into the case.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of officer singing 'Ghar Se Nikalte Hi' is not of Captain Deepak Sathe's
content: Several pictures and videos have been making rounds on the social media platforms in a bid to pay homage to Captain Sathe. A four-minute-long video, purportedly of Captain Deepak Sathe singing the famous Bollywood song 'Ghar Se Nikalte Hi', is widely shared by netizens on social media as a tribute to the brave pilot.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of monks in Kumbh Mela falsely circulated as that of Ayodya bhoomi pujan
content: The foundation stone laying ceremony of the Ram Temple in Ayodhya was held on August 5. A selected guest list of 175 people was made to ensure that Covid-19 norms were followed during the grand event.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video showing cattle being washed away in floodwaters is not from Kerala's Wayanad
content: A video showing a cattle farm being washed away by floods in Mexico has been misleadingly shared with the claim that it is from Kerala’s Wayanad district.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact check: Has Sunni Waqf board decided to build ‘Babri hospital’ on the 5-acre land allotted in Ayodhya?
content: A message is doing the rounds on social media claiming that the Sunni Waqf Board has decided to build a super specialty hospital like AIIMS on the 5 acres of land allotted to them in Ayodhya by the Supreme Court, which will be named after the Babri mosque
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This girl standing next to Sooraj Pancholi is not Sushant Singh Rajput's ex-manager Disha Salian
content: Amid the speculation about a probable connection between Sushant Singh Rajput and Disha Salian's deaths, a party picture is going viral on social media in which actor Sooraj Pancholi is present along with some other people. In this picture, a girl holding a glass and standing next to Sooraj is being referred to as Disha Salian.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Salman Rushdie never said Muslims destroy a nation in the name of Islam
content: According to a message doing the rounds on social media, author of the well-known book Satanic Verses Salman Rushdie has said that the only goal of Muslims in the world, whether they live in India or Pakistan, is to destroy nations by terrorism in the name of Islam.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these cars were not damaged in recent Beirut explosion
content: A picture of rows of cars badly damaged along with smoke all around is being widely circulated on social media. It is being said that this damage took place during the Beirut explosion. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Did communist government in Kerala impose a blackout on August 5?
content: A viral post on social media claims that the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI-M)-led LDF government in Kerala announced a total blackout in the state on August 5 to prevent people from watching the Ram Mandir bhoomi pujan ceremony.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a picture of Beirut after the blasts
content: On Facebook, a collage of two pictures claiming to show Beirut before and after the explosions is going viral. The caption of the post says, "Pray for Lebanon".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Shah Rukh Khan is not donating Rs 5 crore for Ayodhya Ram temple
content: On social media, a viral post claims Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan will donate Rs 5 crore for the Ram mandir. Several Facebook users have posted a graphic collage of the actor and the temple plan, with a text superimposed on it saying, "Shah Rukh Khan Is Going To Donate 5 Cr. To Ram Mandir Trust For Making Ram Mandir".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Stunning image of football field encircled by forests is not from India
content: The 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar might be more than two years away, but football-crazy nations are gearing up for the mega sporting event, albeit with precautions amid the Covid-19 pandemic.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Bihar Congress uses Amphan image to take a dig at Nitish Kumar over floods
content: The verified Facebook page of Bihar Congress posted an image of a woman, wading through a waterlogged street, along with a caption in Hindi which translates to, “Nitish Kumar’s good governance is floating in water. Muzaffarpur, Bhagalpur, Bihar Sharif and Patna were chosen to be smart cities but they are still troubled by water-logging after rains.”
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Men in lingerie passed off as ISIS fighters with bizarre story
content: A couple of pictures of two men in lingerie has gone viral on social media with the claim that they were ISIS terrorists captured by the Syrian army.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This tragic story behind the creation of ‘Subway Surfers’ is not true
content: On social media, a tragic story regarding the origin of the game is being circulated. It is being said that the creator of “Subway Surfers” had made the game in memory of his son who had died while skating down the railway tracks.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Conspiracy theory says Bill Gates-backed polio vaccine disabled 47,000 kids
content: A viral message on Facebook claims that hundreds of doctors had sued Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates after a polio vaccine he had funded left over 47,000 children in India disabled, leading to his expulsion from the country. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that neither was Gates sued nor was he expelled from India.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral tweet of Rajinikanth apologising for travelling without e-pass is fake
content: Recently, pictures and videos of superstar Rajinikanth driving a luxury car and strolling at his farmhouse in Kelambakkam near Chennai went viral on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the tweet was made from a fake account.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Pak social media users appropriate stunning jumps by Indian paratroopers
content: Social media users in Pakistan are widely sharing a split-screen video, which purportedly compares paratroopers from India and Pakistan. The video in which paratroopers are making a bad exit from the aircraft is superimposed with the Indian national flag, while the other video where paratroopers make stunning jumps is superimposed with the Pakistan national flag.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Italy’s Republic Day ceremony passed off as France’s farewell to Rafale
content: A video claiming to show France bidding farewell to Rafales destined for India with its jets forming the Tricolour in the skies has gone viral on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not a Rafale jet refuelling mid-air en route India
content: A viral video claims to show a Rafale jet refuelling mid-air at 30,000 feet while heading for India from France.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of massive crowd at Bengaluru market wasn’t shot this year
content: A video going viral on social media claims that despite Covid-19 regulations, massive crowds are thronging Bengaluru’s KR Market for Varamahalakshmi Vratam festivities.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Kashmir's Hilal Ahmad Rather didn't fly Rafale jet from France to India
content: Though he played a key role in ensuring the delivery of Rafale jets to the country, Hilal Ahmad was not among the seven pilots who flew the fighter jets to India from France.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind Hindustan Murdabad slogans at a Congress event
content: Netizens claim that Congress supporters were raising anti-India slogans.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact check: Old news of kidney stealing from a Muzaffarnagar hospital gone viral linking it falsely to Covid-19
content: The incident mentioned in the claim is over two years old and has nothing to do with Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens fall for parody account of Macron congratulating India on Rafale
content: Many Indian netizens are going gaga over French President Emmanuel Macron congratulated India on Twitter before the first batch of Rafale fighter jets arrived from France. AFWA finds the truth behind the tweet.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: These Ramayana stamps released by PM Modi are not related to bhoomi pujan
content: This set of 11 commemorative postage stamps on Ramayana was released by PM Modi in Varanasi in 2017.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Mystery behind ‘one lakh’ Shiva Lingas in a Karnataka river solved
content: A set of images of several Shiva Lingas carved in stone on a river bed have gone viral with the claim that this is for the first time that lakhs of Shiva Lingas were seen in Karnataka’s Shivakashi river. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Unrelated clips merged to falsely claim that Patna BJP MLA was thrashed
content: A video clip has gone viral on social media with the claim that the Patna BJP MLA was thrashed by locals over bad road conditions.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan flags were not waved at Ashok Gehlot’s rally
content: Amid the political crisis in Rajasthan, a 10-second video of chief minister Ashok Gehlot at a congregation has gone viral with the claim that Pakistan flags were waved at his rally.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Weaver’s suicide wrongly linked to PM Modi and his constituency
content: An image going viral on social media claims that a weaver hung himself from his loom, driven by extreme poverty, in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s constituency Varanasi.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: AIIMS did not issue this misleading statement on corona symptoms
content: A message on Covid-19 symptoms has gone viral on WhatsApp and Facebook, attributing it to the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), New Delhi. India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a misleading claim. AIIMS has not released any such statement, comparing symptoms of different diseases.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Khadi India is not selling three masks for Rs 999
content: A viral post on social media claims that Khadi India has replaced Mahatma Gandhi’s picture with that of PM Modi in its advertisement for face masks, three of which are being sold for Rs 999.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Was Tom Hanks arrested in Australia for pedophilia?
content: A misleading post on social media claims that Hollywood actor Tom Hanks was arrested in Australia for paedophilia.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not how Ram temple at Ayodhya will look like
content: A colourful sketch of a beautiful temple with golden domes and water bodies is circulating on social media with the claim that this is how the grand Ram temple will look like. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Online rumours about AIIMS doctor who saved a critical Covid patient
content: A picture of a doctor from AIIMS, New Delhi, is going viral with the claim that he was infected with coronavirus after giving mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to a critical Covid-19 patient. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: This girl with a beautiful voice is not related to Kishore Kumar
content: A video of a young girl singing Mohammad Rafi's super-hit track "Deewana Hua Badal" in a soothing easy-breezy tone is being widely shared on social media. It is being said that she is the daughter of singer Amit Kumar and the granddaughter of legendary singer Kishore Kumar.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: False claims of Rajiv Gandhi at Ram temple ‘bhoomi pujan’ go viral
content: A photo of former PM Rajiv Gandhi along with some men in religious attire is going viral with the claim that it was taken at the “bhoomi pujan” of the Ram temple in Ayodhya in 1989.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Wrong Azam Khan goes viral over Ram temple ‘bhoomi pujan’ remarks
content: Misleading news reports and social media posts claim that Samajwadi Party MP Azam Khan has said he will take ‘jal samadhi’ in Saryu river if not invited to ‘bhoomi pujan’ of Ayodhya Ram temple on August 5.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens fight over this stunning waterfall. Here’s the truth
content: A small clipping of a beautiful waterfall is being widely shared on social media with the claim that it is the Bhedaghat waterfall in Jabalpur district of Madhya Pradesh.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind video showing two men being thrashed in an office chamber
content: A misleading video has gone viral on social media with the claim that a complainant was being beaten up in front of the district magistrate in Haryana and no action was taken.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: IAF did not conduct airstrike in Nepal, nor was its jet shot down
content: Misleading images on social media claim to show an Indian fighter jet shot down by Nepal after it crossed over into Nepalese territory to conduct an airstrike.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Story of the eagle that ‘refuses’ to leave a Krishna temple
content: A video of a Krishna eagle resting on a Garuda statue in a Krishna temple in Kerala is going viral on social media.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of Muslim youths studying Hindu holy books takes a communal turn
content: A picture of Islamic scholars reading Hindu scriptures has gone viral on social media with a misleading communal claim. India Today's AFWA finds the truth.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: This picture of Trump kissing convicted sex offender Epstein is doctored
content: A sensational image of American President Donald Trump kissing convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is doing the rounds on social media.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: NASA did not introduce a 13th zodiac sign
content: A message circulating on Facebook claims that United States space agency NASA has added a 13th zodiac sign called "Ophiuchus".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Rumours of organ trade under the garb of Covid-19 go viral
content: Some sensational social media posts claim that certain hospitals in Mumbai running organ trafficking rackets during the pandemic. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Old hoaxes about WhatsApp malware go viral again
content: A viral post on Facebook post says WhatsApp is releasing a video called "Martinelli" which when opened will hack one's phone. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Aerial shot of huge region submerged in floodwater is not from Bihar
content: An aerial shot of a huge region submerged in floodwater is being circulated on social media with the claim that it is from Bihar.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Little girl killed in Sri Lanka Easter bombings linked to Covid-19
content: A heart-wrenching image of some people grieving around the body of a little girl is circulating on social media with the claim that the girl had died of Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this Antarctica as seen from space? Not really
content: Recently, scientists have warned of the rapid melting of Antarctica's Thwaites glacier - also known as "Doomsday glacier" for its collapse could submerge many coastal cities worldwide. Amid this, a purported view of Antarctica from space is being widely shared on social media.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Russian rocket crash passed off as India's failed missile test
content: A video of a rocket exploding mid-air within seconds of its launch has been going viral on social media with the claim that this is how an Indian missile test failed. The post goes on to take a dig at India, saying how can such an army fight against Nepal. Is the claim true?
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Unrelated images passed off as visuals from the horrific Assam floods
content: More than 70 lakh people have been affected due to the devastating floods in Assam that have inundated 24 out of the state's 33 districts. Thousands have been rendered homeless and over 80 people have lost their lives, and coupled with the Covid-19 pandemic, Assam is staring at a humanitarian crisis.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Gujarat’s Rani ki Vav shared as palace built by Chola emperor for wife
content: An image of a richly sculpted underground structure is viral on social media with the claim that it was a grand palace built by Chola emperor Rajaraja I for his wife in Gujarat's Patan village. The claim also says that the palace has a 9 km-long subway under it.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of packed crowds in a hospital is not from Bengaluru
content: Video reportedly from Bengaluru’s Victoria Hospital shows a huge crowd of patients in a small space outside an OPD. AFWA finds the truth behind the viral video.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Misleading claims about this boy rescuing a baby deer flood social media
content: A series of images of a young boy trying to rescue a baby deer from the raging floodwaters is circulating on social media with the claim that they are from Assam.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Tata’s concept sedan drives misleading claims on social media
content: A viral post on social media claims that Tata Motors has come up with a new electric car called EVision, which can run up to 1,000 kms on being charged once and the battery has a 10-year warranty.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This bus accident involving Amarnath yatris is three years old
content: A post going viral on social media claims that 16 Amarnath pilgrims were killed after their bus fell into a ravine in Kashmir. India Today's AFWA probes the truth.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of deceased man falsely linked to Covid-19 and Bihar BJP minister
content: A post on social media is going viral with the claim that Covid-19 patient died outside a medical shop in Siwan -- the constituency of Bihar health minister Mangal Pandey.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Murder caught on cam goes viral with communal spin
content: A gruesome video from Delhi showing a man being stabbed to death on a busy road has gone viral with the claim that three Muslim men stabbed a minor Hindu boy to death.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Google, Apple and the Palestine dilemma
content: Social media users shared claims that American tech giants Google and Apple have removed Palestine from their map services.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: The topper who walked out from a tale of twisted truth
content: A motivating post is doing the rounds on social media showing a photo of a young boy who appears to be a cobbler, along with a copy of a marksheet of one Sanjoy Rabidas from West Bengal.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Has Union govt revoked the power of police to grant bail?
content: Social media is agog with claims that the authority of the police to grant bail to an accused person without taking him or her to a magistrate, under Section 41 (A) of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC), has been revoked. The claims say it is a move to beat corruption in policing.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Distressing image of waterlogged hospital goes viral with misleading claim
content: Bihar is currently dealing with the twin crises of Covid-19 and floods. The state went under a 16-day lockdown from today to arrest the spike in coronavirus cases - the same time over a dozen districts have been affected by floodwaters.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Social media claims Kerala gold smuggling accused Swapna Suresh is a Muslim
content: The sensational gold smuggling case in Kerala, involving former consulate employees, has heated up politics in the state.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Hold your beer! She's not Julia Roberts's daughter but a doppelganger
content: A video of a young girl singing "The Girl From Ipanema", the Brazilian jazz smash hit from the 1960s, is quite viral on social media with claims that she is the daughter of Hollywood actor Julia Roberts. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the girl in the viral music video is not the daughter of Julia Roberts, but a lookalike.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: It's too early to predict a bubonic plague epidemic
content: Even as the world battles the deadly Covid-19, reports of bubonic plague cases from Mongolia and China have netizens on the edge.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Owaisi never denied the existence of coronavirus
content: Did Asaduddin Owaisi ever say that coronavirus does not exist and the government is fooling people? India Today Anti Fake News War Room finds out the truth behind the viral claim.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact check: This disturbing viral video of animal cruelty is not of COVID-19 vaccine test
content: A disturbing video purportedly showing animal cruelty circulating on social media claims this is how monkeys are being tortured in laboratories to test the COVID-19 vaccine. Is the claim true?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Covid parties may be happening, but this is something else!
content: An image of a group of youths drinking from a sangria bucket is circulating on social media with the claim that this how Covid parties are being held in Alabama.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of man being thrashed goes viral with communal spin
content: A viral video on social media shows two men thrashing another brutally with sticks, while a burqa-clad woman is trying to save the victim. Netizens are using the video to criticise “Hindutva” and the “fascist Indian government”.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of gold smuggling accused at wedding of Kerala CM's daughter is morphed
content: The viral picture shows Swapna posing for a group photo alongside the newly wedded couple, CM Vijayan, his wife Kamala, and industries and sports minister EP Jayarajan.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not pin your hopes on that 'successful' Russian vaccine
content: On Monday evening, news portals and social media were suddenly flooded by the news that a Russian medical university has completed the trial of the world's first Covid vaccine. People were elated and perplexed at the same time as the news broke. So is the wait really over for an effective Covid-19 vaccine?
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Kerala didn’t bring in new law saying temples can be controlled by non-Hindus
content: A viral post on social media claims that the Kerala government has brought in a new law under which temples can be controlled by Muslims or Christians.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Chopper at Jordan underwater museum shared as IAF Apache below Pangong Tso
content: Though India did deploy Apache choppers in Ladakh in light of recent tensions with China, but they are not underwater.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Mystery behind strange sounds coming from a mountain in China
content: In a video going viral on social media, mysterious sounds were heard from a mountain in China’s Guizhou province and that it was a dragon growling.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Kerala gold smuggling case accused threaten to expose ministers?
content: National Investigation Agency (NIA) took Swapna and another accused into custody from Bengaluru for allegedly trying to smuggle in 30 kg gold worth Rs 15 crore through diplomatic channels in Kerala.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Bipin Rawat seek Army chief’s dismissal over Ladakh crisis?
content: A fake letter going viral on social media claims that Chief of Defence Staff General Bipin Rawat asked Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to dismiss Army chief General MM Naravane.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of sword-wielding men slashing youth goes viral with communal spin
content: A video is going viral on social media with the claim that a group of Muslim youth attacked a Hindu boy named Sanjay Mishra in Nalasopara near Mumbai after his friend got involved in an argument with some locals.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Why Atal Bihari Vajpayee arrived in Parliament on bullock cart
content: A picture of late former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on a bullock cart is viral on social media with the claim that he had arrived at the Parliament to protest against the introduction of computers. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the picture was taken more than a decade before Rajiv Gandhi became Prime Minister.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Pakistan govt ban Mahashivratri celebrations?
content: Taking advantage of the ongoing tensions between religious communities in Pakistan, a post regarding the ban of Mahashivratri celebrations in Karachi is going viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: These are not Kashmiri girls involved in a sex racket in Kulgam
content: The viral claim says that police caught these Kashmiri girls from Kulgam area of Jammu and Kashmir for running a sex racket.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Man kneeling in front of Yogi Adityanath is not Vikas Dubey
content: An image of a man touching Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's feet has gone viral on Facebook with the claim that it is an old photo of don Vikas Dubey prostrating in front of the CM, who is also the head priest of Goraknath temple.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind ‘bodies of Covid-19 patients’ being thrown in the Ganges
content: Pictures showing bodies being thrown into the Ganges in Patna to hide the actual number of Covid deaths are going viral on social media.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Ivanka cite Bihar girl who cycled 1,200 kms to hit out at critics?
content: A viral post on social media attributes a quote to Ivanka Trump, wherein she gives the example of the Bihar girl, who cycled 1,200 km during lockdown carrying her injured father, to hit out at those criticising United States President Donald Trump over the Covid-19 crisis in the country.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind video of Africans performing 'sawan somvar' puja
content: A video of some Africans singing bhajans and conducting Hindu rituals is going viral on social media with the claim that they are performing puja on the occasion of the first Monday of 'Sawan' month.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Did this model make it to Guinness for her dark skin tone?
content: Several websites claimed that Guinness World Records recognised Nyakim Gatwech, an American model of South Sudanese descent, as the "darkest skin ever seen on earth
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind promotion of Muslim woman scientist in ISRO
content: A picture of Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) scientist and Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) alumna Khushboo Mirza is being circulated on social media with the claim that she has been promoted as director of the space agency. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of potholed road in Bihar used to take a dig at Rahul Gandhi
content: The picture is at least three years old and of NH-80 at Bhagalpur in Bihar.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Real story behind man chased by health workers in PPEs
content: A video of policemen and health workers in personal protective equipments trying to restrain a man and then chasing him when he breaks free has netizens in splits. Social media users claim the man is a Covid-19 patient who refused to be hospitalised; some others say the incident is from Telangana.
author: Dheeshma Puzhakkal India Today

title: Fact Check: Fictitious story about woman police officer goes viral
content: A picture of a woman police officer is going viral on social media with the claim that she was appointed inspector in the same area where her father pulls a rickshaw.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Who's this man putting his foot on a Hindu idol?
content: A disturbing picture of a man putting his left foot on a Hindu idol is circulating on Facebook with the claim that his name is Mohammad Ansari.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is that an eagle clutching a shark in its claws?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the viral claims calling the bird an eagle or a condor and the fish a shark are misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Israel bomb Iranian nuclear facilities?
content: A message started circulating on social media, claiming that the Israeli Air Force has bombarded nuclear installations in Iran, practically putting an end to its nuclear ambitions.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This rickshaw-puller was a lockdown saviour, wasn’t jailed for anti-CAA protests
content: A viral picture on social media is being described as that of a rickshaw-puller in Lucknow, who was jailed and fined Rs 21 lakh by the UP government for bringing anti-CAA protesters to rallies.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Are people wearing masks not getting enough oxygen?
content: The video shows a man using an air quality monitoring machine to measure oxygen intake levels before and after wearing a mask.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of military train linked to present Indo-China conflict
content: A post going viral on social media claims that a moving train loaded with military equipment is en route to the Indo-China border amid rising tensions between the two nations.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: US cartoonist Ben Garrison did not make this caricature on Indian media
content: A viral post claims that a caricature depicting PM Modi as a pig was created by American cartoonist Ben Garrison and it depicts the state of Indian media. India Today's AFWA finds the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this Bharat Biotech VP taking the first dose of anti-Covid drug ‘Covaxin’?
content: A picture has gone viral on social media which shows Dr VK Srinivas, vice president of Bharat Biotech, taking the first dose of coronavirus vaccine “Covaxin” developed by his team, as part of human trial.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Kangana release Sridevi's autopsy report with sensational details?
content: A viral social media post claims that Kangana has released late actor Sridevi's autopsy report with several sensational details. The purported autopsy report says she was "clearly forcefully fed" cocaine and whiskey, had three injuries, and it was "not a natural death".
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Nostradamus predict the coronavirus pandemic in 16th century?
content: A viral post on social media claims 16th century French astrologer Nostradamus predicted the coronavirus pandemic. Several Facebook users have attributed a quote to Nostradamus and claimed it was mentioned in his book Les Prophéties (The Prophecies).
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Have Budweiser employees been pissing in their beer tanks?
content: A viral screenshot is claiming about the beer brand 'Budweiser that several Budweiser employees have been urinating into the beer tanks for years.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Was this huge protest in Nepal against Oli govt’s pro-China stance?
content: On Facebook, several users have posted the 35-second clip – a top shot of a large number of people marching on the streets.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens fall for satirical post of Chinese man thrashing Pakistani in Karachi
content: Video of a Chinese man thrashing a Pakistani has gone viral on social media. Various users have shared the video claiming that the Chinese engineer is beating the Pakistani over fake petrol bill.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral WHO warning of Nipah virus outbreak in India is two years old
content: A viral post on social media claims that the World Health Organization has warned of a new Nipah virus outbreak in India, which is deadlier than coronavirus. India Today's AFWA finds the truth.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Army training video goes viral as Chinese forces torturing Indian soldiers
content: The video is of a training session of Bangladeshi soldiers is being misleadingly shared as video of Chinese troops humiliating Indian soldiers in Ladakh.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens confuse Kyrgyz President for Chinese leader to hit out at PM Modi
content: A photo of PM Modi meeting Kyrgyz President Sooronbay Jeenbekov at the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit is being misleadingly shared as him meeting his "Chinese bosses".
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Muslim members in AYUSH ministry conspire against Baba Ramdev's Coronil?
content: A viral post on Facebook and Twitter claims that the AYUSH ministry imposed restrictions on Coronil because the "scientific panel" that approves drugs has six Muslims. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral claim is false.
author: Jyoti Dwivedi India Today

title: Fact Check: Has Bhutan deliberately blocked irrigation water to Indian farmers in Assam?
content: A viral post on social media claims that amid India's border rows with neighbouring countries, now Bhutan has stopped the supply of irrigation water to farmers in Assam.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of mob vandalising petrol pump has no link to recent oil price hike
content: A video of a group of people vandalising a petrol pump has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is how protests against oil price hike have broken out. The video has been shared on Facebook by various users.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Mumbai doc, whose Covid tips are viral, has no link to Nanavati hospital
content: Multiple Facebook users have shared a message from a Mumbai-based gynaecologist believing her to be associated with Mumbai’s famous Nanavati hospital.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Bond girl in bikini passed off as Sonia Gandhi
content: A black-and-white picture of woman in a bikini is being shared online and it is being claimed that the woman is Congress president Sonia Gandhi. India Today's AFWA probed the claim.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Is Bank of China opening its first branch in India amid border tensions?
content: A viral post on social media claims that the RBI has given a license to the Bank of China to operate in India amid border tensions between the two countries.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral image of Indira Gandhi addressing soldiers is not from Galwan Valley
content: A picture of former PM late Indira Gandhi addressing soldiers in the backdrop of a mountain range has gone viral on social media.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Can you identify a “Made in China” product just by its barcode?
content: A viral post claims that one can differentiate between Chinese and Indian products just by the barcodes on them. India Today's AFWA investigated the claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of jawans injured in bus accident linked to Galwan valley clash
content: The 1-minute-41-second video shows some soldiers lying on the ground, crying in pain.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind pics showing Rahul Gandhi with Chinese envoys
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has stepped up attacks against the government over the martyrdom of 20 Indian soldiers in a bloody face-off with Chinese troops in eastern Ladakh's Galwan Valley.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video from Kashmir linked to Indo-China flare-up in Ladakh
content: India lost 20 Army men in a bloody face-off with China late on Monday night at Galwan Valley in eastern Ladakh. The Chinese side also suffered unconfirmed fatalities.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Bodies of Nigerian soldiers killed by Boko Haram passed off as Indian jawans martyred in Ladakh
content: A picture purportedly showing bodies of Indian soldiers martyred in the faceoff with Chinese troops in Galwan Valley of eastern Ladakh has gone viral on social media.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Does this herbal medicine from Tanzania cure Covid-19?
content: A Facebook post has gone viral with the claim that the Tanzanian government has approved a herbal medicine called Covidol, which will cure patients suffering from Covid-19. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the Tanzanian government has not approved the medicine as a Covid-19 cure.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Disturbing image from Bangladesh used to mock Atmanirbhar Bharat
content: A disturbing image of a woman hanging from a tree and a toddler's body floating in a pond is going viral on social media with the claim that this is the plight of people in "Atmanirbhar Bharat".
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: WHO did not say that Covid-19 is getting weaker
content: A viral post on Facebook claims a study conducted by World Health Organization has found that coronavirus is losing potency and getting weaker. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be untrue.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture from Venezuela passed off as “atrocities on Muslims by Indian Army”
content: A disturbing image showing several bodies lying on the street is going viral on social media with the claim that the Indian Army has massacred Muslims in Kashmir.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: What did WHO say about asymptomatic transmission of Covid-19?
content: A video clip of a WHO official saying that asymptomatic coronavirus patients do not need to isolate at a press conference is circulating on social media with the claim that the global health body has taken a “complete U-turn”.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Tracing the quarantine facility where people are grooving to ‘Lungi Dance’
content: The India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that a viral video of people doing the 'Lungi Dance' is not from Mumbai or Chennai, but from a quarantine centre in Agartala, Tripura.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video showing medical staff cheering is not from New Zealand
content: A viral video shows medical staff cheering after the last coronavirus patient recovered in New Zealand and the Covid-19 ward was shut. However, an AFWA investigation found the claim to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This Covid-19 prescription is not given by Delhi’s Sir Ganga Ram Hospital
content: Sir Ganga Ram hospital authorities have dissociated themselves from the viral prescription. The doctor in question said someone misused or forged his letterhead, stamp and signature.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Facebook is not using posts made by users in lawsuits against them
content: A viral post on Facebook says that amid the Covid-19 pandemic, the social networking platform has changed its privacy rules, allowing it to use pictures and posts shared by users in lawsuits against them.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Mixing lemon and baking soda in tea won't kill coronavirus
content: A message going viral on Facebook and WhatsApp claims that there has not been a single death in Israel due to coronavirus as they mix lemon and baking soda in their tea. The claim goes on to say that this combination kills the virus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not an Israeli soldier killing a Palestinian boy
content: A picture of a security official kneeling on the neck of a bleeding boy is going viral on social media with the claim that this was how a Palestinian child was killed by an Israeli soldier.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of people punching Trump dummy resurfaces with wrong claim
content: A video of people punching and kicking a life-sized doll of Trump has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is how Americans are now treating their President. India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found that the viral video is four years old and has nothing to do with the recent protests in the US.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Brahmins didn't cut off girl's tongue in UP to stop coronavirus
content: A picture of a girl with injuries in her mouth is going viral on social media with the claim that Brahmins in Uttar Pradesh's Bundelkhand region cut off the tongue of a Class 8 girl and offered it as a sacrifice to Lord Shiva to prevent coronavirus infections in their village. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the girl had herself bit off her tongue and offered it a sacrifice to Lord Shiva to save her village from coronavirus.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Pic of MM Joshi offering sweets to PM Modi has no link to Ram temple
content: A picture of veteran BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi offering sweets to Prime Minister Narendra Modi began circulating on Facebook and WhatsApp. Users claim Joshi offered sweets to Modi as soon as construction of the Ram temple began in Ayodhya.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Delhi Public School is not selling masks to students
content: Social media users have claimed that Delhi Public School is selling face masks to students for Rs 400. However, India Today's AFWA found this claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Three-year-old photo goes viral linking it to present migrant crisis
content: Netizens are sharing a picture of toddler breastfeeding from mother lying dead on the railway tracks in MP to highlight the present migrant crisis in India.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Jyotiraditya Scindia remove “BJP” from his Twitter bio?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that viral posts saying BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia removed “BJP” from his Twitter bio are misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This picture of couple kissing was not taken during George Floyd protests
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the picture to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact check: This man is not the killer of pregnant elephant in Kerala
content: The recent death of a pregnant elephant allegedly caused by consuming explosive-filled pineapple in Kerala has triggered nationwide outrage.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Seven-month-old video goes viral linking it to cyclone Nisarga
content: Heavy rains and strong winds lashed parts of Maharashtra and Gujarat as cyclone Nisarga made a landfall on Wednesday. Multiple videos and images of the same are also doing the rounds on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Japanese Nobel laureate never said China manufactured coronavirus
content: The viral post claims that as per Honjo, if coronavirus was natural, it would not have affected the whole world.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image from Spain goes viral as corona protests against Trump in US
content: With protests raging across the United States over the death of African-American George Floyd in police custody, a picture of thousands of people marching with flags and banners is viral on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did a US city deploy child soldiers to quell protests over George Floyd's death?
content: The uniformed persons in riot gear seen in the video are members of Georgia National Guard and of eligible age to join the force.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim of China killing 158 Indian jawans is a three-year-old fake
content: Amid the ongoing India-China border standoff, a viral post, along with an image of army vehicles on fire, is circulating on social media with the claim that 158 Indian soldiers were killed in a rocket attack by the Chinese army in Sikkim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Pics of pre-wedding shoot go viral as corona patient in love with doctor
content: A post was going viral on social media claiming that a man was a Covid-19 patient who fell in love with his lady doctor. The two got engaged in the same hospital in Egypt.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Old images of US forest fires passed off as crisis in Uttarakhand
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that most photos used in the viral post are unrelated and old.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old picture of Chinese aggression passed off as recent crisis in Ladakh
content: Amid tension between India and China along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Ladakh, a picture of a group of men holding a Chinese flag and a red banner near a lake is going viral on social media with the claim that this is from Galwan Valley, one of the flashpoints.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Why you should never leave a hand sanitiser bottle in your car
content: Several posts on social media claim that a bottle of sanitiser can cause fire in a car. Speaking to experts and looking into the material safety data of hand sanitisers, India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that it is extremely unlikely that a bottle of sanitiser will burst into fire on its own. But there are several ifs and buts.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Justin Trudeau speak against Islamophobia in this year's Eid message?
content: A video clip of a speech by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau wishing people on Eid al-Fitr and speaking about his government's resolution to fight against Islamophobia has gone viral on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the speech to be from last year's Eid.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, China has not killed 75 Indian soldiers in Ladakh
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found the claim that Chinese troops have killed 75 Indian jawans in Ladakh to be false.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of street brawl linked to Eid celebrations
content: A 30-second video, claimed to be shot on the occasion of Eid, shows a group of men, many in traditional Muslim clothes, throwing punches, grappling and screaming at each other. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be misleading. The incident took place in August last year and has no relation to Eid celebrations.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Blood clot the main reason for Covid-19 death, claims conspiracy theory
content: Have Italian doctors discovered such a secret about the coronavirus crisis that they dared to discard World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of woman being thrashed brutally goes viral with communal twist
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that a viral video claiming a Muslim woman was being brutally beaten in UP to be false.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, “Chowkidar Chor Hai” slogans were not raised during PM’s Bengal visit
content: After PM Modi visited West Bengal to conduct an aerial survey of the damage caused by Cyclone Amphan, videos circulated showing crowds chanting "Chowkidar Chor Hai" during the PM's visit.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: One-year-old videoclip of cyclone Fani passed off as cyclone Amphan on social media
content: People have claimed that this scene is just before the landfall of cyclone Amphan in Bengal.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Rahul Gandhi stage his meeting with migrants at Delhi’s Sukhdev Vihar?
content: The viral claim says the woman was brought in a car for the “photo-op”.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Six-year-old picture goes viral as plight of migrants during lockdown
content: Migrant labourers have been among the worst affected sections in India due to the lockdown. With production and construction activities halted, lack of money and food has forced lakhs of desperate migrants across India to reach for their homes on foot in the absence of proper transportation.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Dr Devi Shetty never advised these 22 steps to avoid coronavirus
content: A viral post suggesting 22 steps to protect oneself from a coronavirus infection is being attributed to renowned Indian cardiac surgeon Dr Devi Shetty.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Old videos of supermarket thefts go viral linking them to Ramadan
content: A video of two burqa-clad women pulling out a horde of items from under their garments at a supermarket is going viral on social media with the claim that they were stolen for 'iftar' during Ramadan.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Kumbh Mela buses passed off as migrant buses arranged by Priyanka Gandhi
content: An image of hundreds of buses standing in a row on a highway went viral on social media with the claim that these are the buses Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi arranged for migrants, but UP CM Yogi Adityanath denied permission for them to ply.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video showing plight of Hindus is from Haryana and not Rajasthan
content: In a viral video, claimed to be shot in Rajasthan, a woman explains how Muslims attacked Hindu houses and took away their men, and how police have turned a blind eye to their plight. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be misleading. The video is not from Rajasthan but Haryana.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind viral picture of Donald Trump greeting Osama Bin Laden
content: A picture, purportedly showing United States President Donald Trump in his younger days, shaking hands with global terror mastermind Osama Bin Laden, is going viral on social media.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this video does not show Muslim brutalities on Hindus in Bengal
content: A disturbing video of two men being brutally thrashed by a group of people is circulating on WhatsApp and Twitter with the claim that this is how Muslims are committing atrocities on Hindus in Bengal.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Jyotiraditya Scindia to stay in BJP... at least for now
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the Twitter handle which shared the viral tweet is not the official Twitter handle of “India TV” or in any way associated with the news channel.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post saying Bill Gates violated social distancing norms is misleading
content: It is being claimed that a photo shows Bill Gates and Dr Anthony Fauci violating the social distancing norms.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of Muslims offering namaaz goes viral with wrong claim
content: A video of Muslims offering namaaz on the road is circulating on social media with the claim that this is how lockdown rules are being flouted in Delhi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Images of anti-Hindu violence in Pakistan passed off as riots in Bengal
content: Communal violence broke out at Telinipara in Hooghly district of West Bengal recently, following which Section 144 was imposed and Internet snapped.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of attack on Nitish Kumar’s convoy is two years old
content: The viral post gives the impression that the incident happened recently
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: PM Modi’s Madame Tussauds prep video linked to Tuesday speech
content: On May 12, just hours before Narendra Modi’s address to the nation, a video began circulating on social media showing the Prime Minister in a make-up session along with international experts.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old pic of KCR’s Ramadan gift for Muslims goes viral with misleading claim
content: Is the Telangana government distributing Ramadan gifts to Muslims in the middle of the coronavirus crisis? This is what is being claimed with a picture of a pink bag that has “Eid Mubarak, RAMZAN GIFT, Government of Telangana” written on it.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of police torture goes viral with misleading claim
content: A video of three men kneeling down and police thrashing them is going viral on social media with the claim that this is how labourers from Bihar are being treated during the lockdown.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Has WHO said vegetarians are safe from coronavirus?
content: A viral message on social media claims that no vegetarian has been affected by coronavirus because it requires animal fat in the body to survive. The claim has been attributed to the World Health Organization (WHO).
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: The corpse wears Prada? No, this is a spoof
content: Many have taken to social media claiming that “Prada” is now making bags for corpses. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral video is actually a spoof.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Has Google Maps removed LoC from Indian map?
content: A viral map shows Jammu and Kashmir as a whole, without a line separating PoK, suggesting that PoK is a part of India. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be incorrect.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Can prolonged use of masks cause oxygen deficiency and fatigue?
content: A few social media users claim prolonged use of masks cause hypoxia, oxygen deficiency in the body and fatigue.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: There’s a lion’s share of fiction in this viral video
content: Is a pride of lions roaming the streets of Delhi? Many social media users certainly believe so. A video of a group of female lions and their cubs strolling on the roadside, shot from inside a car, is going viral on social media with the claim that they were spotted at Dhaula Kuan near Delhi Cantonment.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Misleading TikTok video on Covid-19 falsely attributed to Ganga Ram hospital
content: In the video, a man is advising people to drink a lot of water and gargle with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar to kill coronavirus.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of this playful deer by the sea is not from lockdown in India
content: A heart-warming video of a deer playing on a sea beach is circulating on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp with the claim that it was spotted near Chandrabhaga in Odisha, on the Puri-Konark marine drive road.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Were fake notes seized from a temple in Gujarat during lockdown?
content: A viral post on social media claims that at a time the country is struggling against the coronavirus pandemic, a temple in Gujarat was busted manufacturing fake notes.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Don’t believe this story about an 8-year-old boy suffering from Covid-19
content: The post, uploaded on April 29, has been shared more than 2.04 lakh times till the filing of this story.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not click on this dubious web link to claim GST refund
content: One message that is going viral on social media claims the government has introduced online processing of Goods and Services Tax (GST) refunds due to the coronavirus outbreak.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of drunken cop linked to liquor shops opening after lockdown relaxation
content: The 90-second video with a logo of "News 18" shows an inebriated policeman, lying on the roadside, being taken away by other cops on a motorcycle. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is three years old with no connection to the lockdown and subsequent reopening of liquor shops.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, White House is not selling commemorative coronavirus coins
content: The White House has come under attack on social media for allegedly capitalising on the Covid-19 pandemic by selling commemorative coins for $100. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is it illegal to circulate PDFs of e-paper?
content: A recent report by "Dainik Bhaskar", which says it is illegal to forward e-paper PDFs in WhatsApp groups and action can be taken against the group administrator in case of non-compliance, has come as a surprise to netizens.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This website of a 'government' scheme for Rs 50,000 aid is fake
content: The central government, however, has not launched any such scheme. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has clarified the same and asked people to be wary of such fraudulent websites that ask for one's personal information and money.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact check: Clickbait Facebook post on Covid-19 urging for shares gone viral
content: A Facebook post with a collage of three images showing an ailing woman and a kid and a crying man has gone viral with an emotional appeal related to coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Popular bakery in Mumbai finds itself in the middle of coronavirus rumours
content: Many social media users have shared concerns after a message started going viral asking people not to eat Wibs bread as its workers have tested positive for Covid-19 and the factory has been sealed.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Can this anti-tuberculosis vaccine prevent coronavirus?
content: Recently, multiple news reports have cited a study to claim that the anti-tuberculosis Bacillus Calmette-Guérin (BCG) vaccine may be effective against Covid-19. This claim is viral on Facebook and WhatsApp.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today
