title: Fact Check: Hindu woman who organised sehri for Kashmiri girl was not attacked by RSS
content: A post claiming "RSS goons" attacked a Hindu woman because she organised sehri for a Kashmiri Muslim girl during Ramadan has gone viral.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: CCTV clip of car mowing down mother & child goes viral with communal twist
content: A CCTV footage showing a car swerving to the roadside and ploughing a group of pedestrians from behind is going viral on social media. It is being claimed that a Muslim woman in hijab and her daughter were walking on the roadside when an Alto deliberately hit them from behind and killed them in UP's Ballia.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Has Delhi govt asked docs on corona duty to foot their own hotel bills?
content: A video is going viral on social media in which a woman claims that the Delhi government, which was paying for the doctors' hotels stay, won't be doing so any further. What is the truth?
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Ozone layer is healing, but it has nothing to do with lockdown
content: Netizens claim that the healing of the ozone layer is one of the positive effects of the lockdown. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake claim of China shipping clothes of Covid patients to Africa goes viral
content: Facebook user "Thee Talkingbook" posted the picture with the caption, "This clothes are those who died in China. Affected with the COVID 19. They are shipping it to Africa. So we need to be Aware."
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: First volunteer of UK corona vaccine trial is alive and kicking
content: It came as utter shock to many on social media when an online news website claimed on Sunday that the first volunteer for a human trial of the coronavirus vaccine in the United Kingdom has died. What's the truth?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post about this doctor's death due to coronavirus is fake
content: A set of two photos has gone viral on social media with the claim that a 28-year-old doctor in Maharashtra, Dr. Maneesha Patil, has died of Covid-19 while treating patients infected with coronavirus. While one of the photos shows a woman with a stethoscope around her neck, the other shows a woman and a man in medical costume.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post on BJP MP's wife taking flight during lockdown is misleading
content: With all domestic and international flight services suspended as part of the coronavirus lockdown, a picture of a BJP MP's wife on a flight has gone viral on social media.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: This woman was not a doctor who died of coronavirus
content: More than 50 doctors and healthcare workers in India have tested positive of coronavirus. Deaths of doctors from Covid-19 have also been reported from different states.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact check- Fictitious Facebook post with unrelated picture looks for shares with emotional Covid-19 story
content: An emotional Facebook post with a photograph of a woman visibly in pain wearing an oxygen mask while holding a man from behind, has gone viral on social media. It is being claimed that this woman is pregnant and has been tested positive for Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Has MHA ordered arrest of firm owner if employee tests Covid positive?
content: To mitigate the hardships faced by common people, the central government, along with states and union territories, has allowed some industrial and financial activities to resume from April 20. But these will be done under the strict guidelines set by the Home and health ministries.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Germany send China a £130 billion bill for coronavirus damages?
content: A news report by Express whose display headline claims that Germany has sent China a £130 billion bill for coronavirus damages has gone viral on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Canadian PM Trudeau is not packing Covid-19 relief materials
content: A video of Justin Trudeau packing food items has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is how the Canadian Prime Minister is lending a helping hand to his countrymen during the Covid-19 pandemic.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of man putting his spit on bread packets is old and not from India
content: A video of a man licking his fingers while sealing bread packets has gone viral on social media with communal undertones during the Covid-19 pandemic. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral video is neither from India, nor does it have any link to coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post appealing for Facebook shares for ‘Covid-19 patient’ is fictitious
content: The viral post has a collage of two images – one showing a woman in a hospital bed, and the other of a girl with tears in her eyes.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Yediyurappa did not attend Kumaraswamy Junior’s wedding amid lockdown
content: Several social media posts are claiming that Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa also attended the wedding of HD Kumaraswamy’s son on Friday despite the lockdown.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Baseless rumours about slashing pension create panic
content: A message has been circulating on WhatsApp and Facebook that the government is going to slash the pension of employees by 30 per cent and terminate it for those above the age of 80.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Are Chinese being barred in Australian supermarkets over Covid fears?
content: A video showing two men almost coming to blows is being circulated on Internet with the claim that Chinese are not being allowed in Australian supermarkets.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of man being thrashed falsely linked to corona lockdown
content: A video of a group of men brutally thrashing another man has gone viral on social media, linking it to the Covid-19 lockdown. The 2-minute-20-second video shows a man tied to a tree, while others are flogging and kicking him.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Photo of Muslims offering namaaz in groups is not from India
content: At a time governments and health experts around the world are stressing on social distancing to contain the spread of coronavirus, a photo of Muslims offering namaaz in groups on rooftops has gone viral on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the photo to be false. This photo of namaaz in groups is from Dubai. However, similar incidents have been reported in India too.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Still from TV series goes viral as docs dying of coronavirus in Italy
content: A picture showing some people in medical uniforms lying on the floor of a high-tech hospital ward has gone viral on social media. It is being claimed with the photo that over 200 doctors and nurses have died in Italy due to coronavirus.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind 'lockdown violators' cleaning lake in Karnataka
content: in Lathicharge, sit-ups, crawling - police in India have been ruthless in enforcing the coronavirus lockdown. And now, a picture of some people cleaning a lake is going viral with the claim that police in Karnataka are asking lockdown violators to clean up public places as punishment.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not believe this hoax about funeral home worker cremated alive while taking a nap
content: An article by "Weekly Inquirer", which has been replicated by other websites, claims that a New York funeral company accidentally cremated one of its employees who fell asleep after working 16 hours straight. What is the truth?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Worried over getting coronavirus from your pet? Here is the truth
content: Soon after news of a tiger in New York's Bronx zoo testing positive for Covid-19 went viral, netizens started getting anxious about their pets.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of Bangladeshi immigrants in Malaysia viral as plight of 'Hindus' in India
content: An image of scores of people sleeping, crammed on the floor, has gone viral on Facebook with the claim that these are not "Tablighis" but "poor Hindus" who are stranded in India due to the coronavirus lockdown, and both the Modi government and media are indifferent towards their plight.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Relief materials being sold at grocery shop? Video is from Pakistan
content: A viral video appears to show a man at a grocery shop trying to exchange or sell the extra rations donated to him. Is the clip from India? Here's what India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room found.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Do kalonji seeds have the 'miracle drug' US is after?
content: In the absence of a vaccine for Covid-19 as of yet, social media is full of home remedies to cure a coronavirus infection.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Fake sanitisers seized in Bangladesh, pics viral in India with communal spin
content: At a time India is facing a shortage of face masks and hand sanitisers in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak, images of "fake hand sanitisers" have gone viral with a communal spin.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: False claim about Maulana Saad donating Rs 1 crore to PM CARES goes viral
content: A viral image shows the front page headline of "News Letter" saying that Molana Saad donated an amount of 1 crore to the PM MODI Relief Fund. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false. The viral image of the newspaper is morphed.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: False warnings about robbers handing out anesthesia-laden masks go viral
content: Some videos accompanied by a message is going viral on WhatsApp, Facebook and YouTube, warning people that criminals are handing out anesthesia-laden face masks to unsuspecting civilians and then rob them as the users are knocked unconscious.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth of corona conspiracy theory behind arrest of Harvard professor
content: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, a conspiracy theory is viral on social media. A message with a video clip is circulating on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp claiming that US authorities have arrested Dr Charles Lieber, a Harvard professor, for creating coronavirus and selling it to China.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Brazilians observe PM Modi's 'lights out' call?
content: A video is circulating on social media with the claim that this speech of PM Modi was broadcast on TV channels in Brazil, following which on April 4, Brazilians observed his "lights out" call. The viral video shows people on the streets with their mobile phone flashlights on and playing music.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral lockdown phases to control Covid-19 have not been endorsed by WHO
content: At a time Indians are anxious about the government’s next move on the coronavirus lockdown, a message attributed to World Health Organization.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Misleading claim about Covid-19 patient goes viral
content: The Covid-19 pandemic has claimed the lives of several health workers across the world. These were people treating patients infected with coronavirus. A recent report says more than 60 doctors have died in Italy during the outbreak.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of Pope kissing feet of people has no relation to coronavirus
content: Viral video of Pope kissing feet of people is one year old and has no relation to novel coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This India Today screenshot about extension of lockdown is doctored
content: Neither has the prime minister made any such announcement nor have India Today or Aaj Tak broadcast any such news reports.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Bill Gates call coronavirus 'a great corrector'?
content: There is no evidence which confirms that Bill Gates wrote the viral letter on Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post saying Italians are throwing their money on the streets is false
content: A pair of images showing currency notes littered all around is going viral on social media with the claim that Italians are throwing away their money on the streets as it is useless to them now. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the pictures to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Can UV rays from sunlight kill coronavirus?
content: We can conclude that a concentrated form of UVC ray might kill Covid-19 but this is not advisable by any researcher and WHO as exposure to this UV ray is harmful to human skin cells.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not filmmaker Sudhir Mishra getting beaten up by police
content: Since the nationwide lockdown came into force from March 25, Internet is full of videos of cops thrashing civilians on the streets.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Air India is not evacuating Indians stranded in UK
content: Amid worldwide travel restrictions due to coronavirus, a message on social media is going viral with the claim that Air India is operating evacuation flights from Delhi and Mumbai for Indians stuck in London.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: WHO never asked people to avoid bakery items due to coronavirus
content: The latest 'advisory' doing the rounds on Internet has a logo of the World Health Organization (WHO) and asking people not to eat bakery items as they are not washable and get infected from the coronavirus easily.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did a policeman get beaten up while enforcing corona lockdown?
content: Some photos are circulating on the Internet showing a man thrashing a cop on the road. It is being claimed that this is the result of police atrocities on people during the lockdown. Users are also requesting policemen to understand the helplessness of citizens.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Don't believe this home remedy to cure Covid-19
content: Many bizarre treatments to cure those infected with novel coronavirus or Covid-19 are doing rounds on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. There is no remedy for Covid-19 as yet and the claim posted by social media users has no scientific proof.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post saying Italian PM surrendered to Covid-19 is fake
content: According to the viral post, Italian PM Giuseppe Conte said the country has surrendered to the Covid-19 pandemic as all the reliefs have been exhausted. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found the viral post to be fake.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact check: No, Jio has not offered Rs 498 free recharge amid coronavirus lockdown
content: Has Jio announced a free recharge worth Rs 498 for all Indian citizens?
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video of mass graves is not from Italy but from a TV series
content: The AFWA has reached to a conclusion that this viral video is part of a TV series and not from Italy.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact check: Audio clip stating 59 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur is fake
content: Have the number of Coronavirus positive cases crossed 59 in Nagpur?
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Old pictures of Kanika Kapoor with Prince Charles go viral after coronavirus hits royal family
content: The Prince was hospitalised on Tuesday night and is said to be stable.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Visuals from Croatia earthquake passed off as corona crisis in Italy
content: Images of hospital beds and patients being treated in the open are going viral on social media with the claim that hospitals in Italy have run out of space due to the spread of coronavirus. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the photographs are not from Italy but Croatia.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Are coronavirus tests most expensive in India?
content: With more than 19,000 deaths and over 4 lakh infected, and numbers rising by the hour, the world is racing to develop a cure for the deadly coronavirus, along with providing affordable testing kits for the populace.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Olympics did not redesign its logo on social distancing theme
content: An image is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that the Tokyo Olympics logo has been redesigned in the wake of the coronavirus outbreak.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post claims China's whistleblower doctor suggested tea cures Covid-19
content: There is no evidence that supports the claim of the social media users and hence the post is misleading.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Love in the time of Corona? Know the truth behind this viral image
content: Amid the coronavirus pandemic, an image of a couple has caught the attention of social media. Many users have posted the image of a man and woman with masks undone, holding each other closely, and claimed that this is a doctor couple in Italy who have treated more than 134 Covid-19 patients, but died on the eighth day giving in to the deadly disease.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Police did not fix timings for grocery and medical stores in Mumbai
content: Essential services such as grocery and medical shops have been exempted from the lockdown
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: False message of Assam lockdown goes viral amid Covid-19 scare
content: A message is going viral on social media with the claim that the entire state of Assam has been locked down. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not the PM of Italy crying over Covid-19 deaths
content: A photo of a crying man is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that this is the Italian Prime Minister who could not control his tears over the rising death toll due to Covid-19 in his country. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral post is misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Image of Covid-19 testing kit passed off as vaccine on social media
content: If some social media users are to be believed, American scientists have already developed a cure for Covid-19. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is misleading and the photo being shared is not a vaccine to cure Covid-19, but a testing kit developed by South Korea.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Putin has not unleashed lions on Russian streets to enforce Corona lockdown
content: A post is going viral claiming that Russian President Vladimir Putin has released 800 tigers and lions across the country's streets to force people inside. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: This picture of coffins has no relation to Covid-19 deaths in Italy
content: A picture showing a hall full of coffins has gone viral on social media with the claim that these are the coffins of Covid-19 patients who died in a single day in Italy. What is the truth behind it?
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Has the Covid-19 lockdown returned dolphins and swans to Italian waterways?
content: Amid an environment of panic, a social media post has generated some cheer. The post claims that due to the lockdown in Italy, dolphins and swans are returning to its canals, waterways and ports. With over 4,800 deaths, Italy has reported the highest number of casualties due to Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, clapping together at 5 pm during Janta curfew will not kill coronavirus
content: Several people on social media have come out with various theories and claimed that clapping together at 5 pm would make such a "vibration" in the atmosphere that coronavirus will be destroyed.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind video of people rioting on London streets fearing coronavirus lockdown
content: Business is slowing down globally and there are predictions of further damage to the world economy on account of COVID-19. Amid panic-buying of essential commodities in different countries, a video of some people vandalising and breaking into a store is doing the rounds on social media.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Social media users give misleading twist to PM Modi's concept of 'Janta curfew'
content: Social media users have started interpreting Prime Minister Narendra Modi's new term 'Janta curfew' by giving bizarre 'scientific' explanations. India Today Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading since the PM did not mention any particular 'scientific' logic behind it.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this COVID-19 patient is not the wife of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau
content: The woman is seen describing her medical condition in ICU and warning people not to take chances.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact check: False coronavirus quote attributed to US President Donald Trump
content: The quote was falsely attributed to the US President and the claim on social media is not true.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact check: Panic buying in Germany? This video is 9 years old
content: The claim posted on Facebook is misleading as the video is nine years old and has nothing to do with the novel coronavirus.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, US President Donald Trump is not being treated for coronavirus
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the video has nothing to do with the novel coronavirus.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral audio clip on coronavirus is not Dr Devi Shetty's
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War room ( AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim, as this is not the audio message of Dr Devi Shetty. The viral audio clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Bogus info about govt spraying chemicals to kill coronavirus goes viral
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false, as there is no such government order for residents of Chandigarh, Bengaluru, or any other city.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Know the truth behind viral video of passenger agitation at Delhi airport
content: Two videos of agitated passengers arguing with officials at an airport lounge have gone viral on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that it is an old incident of chaos breaking out at T3 of IGIA.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not trust this viral remedy of using hairdryer to cure coronavirus
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War room (AFWA) has found the viral post to be misleading. There is no proven evidence that hot air application through hairdryer can cure the Covid-19.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump never said coronavirus vaccine is ready for use
content: Trump never said that the coronavirus vaccine will be launched by Roche next Sunday. Sause had just thanked FDA for approval for coronavirus tests. The company was given emergency approval for coronavirus tests and not the vaccine.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, gargling with warm salt water can't save you from coronavirus
content: An image is viral on the internet which says that one can eliminate the virus by drinking lots of water and gargling with warm water mixed with salt or vinegar. AFWA has found that WHO has debunked a similar claim which says that rinsing your nose with saline will help prevent a coronavirus infection.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Dubious websites offer free masks on behalf of PM Modi to fight coronavirus
content: Amid the coronavirus scare, a message, along with a web link, is going viral on WhatsApp groups and Facebook, saying that by logging on to the link, one will get free masks from the Narendra Modi government. India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found the web links to be fake.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Pro-democracy clash in Hong Kong passed off as China's crackdown on coronavirus patients
content: A video showing a crackdown by security forces at a metro station is going viral on social media with the claim that this is how police in China are facing difficulties while catching people infected from coronavirus. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video has nothing to do with the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Actor Tom Hanks is taken ill by COVID-19, but this is a hoax
content: Netizens went into utter shock when a website called "the-daily-star.com" ran a piece of news with the headline, "BREAKING: CORONAVIRUS CLAIMS LIFE OF TOM HANKS".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens blame Yogi govt in UP for shocking old incident
content: Netizens are sharing the image, claiming the incident took place under the Yogi Adityanath government. The clipping says the khap panchayat issued the order after the brother of the Dalit sisters eloped with a married woman from the Jat community.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: World is not going to end on April 29
content: Amid coronavirus scare, which has left more than 4,000 people dead, netizens are now hit by the fear of a celestial object.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, China is not supplying Quran as antidote to coronavirus
content: A video claiming that China is supplying Quran to people to read after the coronavirus outbreak is being shared on Facebook by several users. What is the truth behind the claim?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Bullied Australian kid Quaden Bayles did not commit suicide
content: Nine-year-old Quaden Bayles recently went viral after his mother posted a video of him crying and repeatedly saying he wanted to die after being bullied at school. But now a video message is going viral claiming that he has committed suicide. India Today's AFWA has found the post to be a hoax.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Women's Day picture from Maharashtra goes viral with misleading claim
content: Amid International Women's Day celebrations on March 8, two pictures of a young girl in hijab with policemen are going viral with the claim that a 24-year-old Muslim girl in Mumbai qualified the IAS exam. But, what is the truth?
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image from Kashmir linked to Delhi violence
content: A picture showing security personnel kicking a man is going viral on social media with a sarcastic claim that this was how Delhi Police appealed to Muslims for peace.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Social media raps a flawed tune. Eminem is not down with coronavirus
content: An Instagram post claims that American rapper Marshall Bruce Mathers, popularly known as Eminem, has been diagnosed with coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Taliban suicide bomber passed off as Delhi riot accused
content: A Facebook post with a picture of a man in suicide vest is going viral on social media. The post calimed that a huge cache of explosives, suicide vests, time bombs, alarm clocks, mobile phones, SIM cards and cash were recovered from the raids. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the post to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Delhi govt advert for riot victims morphed with communal twist
content: A viral photo of a Hindi newspaper advertising the Delhi government’s assistance scheme for riot victims gives the impression that the government is providing monetary help only to Muslim victims. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the viral image to be morphed.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Disgusting video of woman mixing urine in food goes viral with communal spin
content: A video is being shared on social media in which a woman is seen mixing her urine in the food that was to be served to her employer. The video is posted with claims that the maid is a Muslim, and employed by a Hindu.India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be misleading. The video is nine years old and the maid was not a Muslim.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This post on biryani is too sour to consume
content: A set of pictures of a man serving biryani on a plate and some medicines is going viral on social media with a communal twist.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not the son of IB operative Ankit Sharma killed in Delhi riots
content: A viral picture picture of a weeping kid staring at the body of a man is being shared with claim that this is the son of Intelligence Bureau operative Ankit Sharma. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. The boy in the viral image is not related to Ankit Sharma.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral picture of woman hugging crying kids is not from India
content: A picture of a woman hugging three crying children is going viral on social media with the claim that it is from India. However, India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. This is a six-year-old photo from the Syrian conflict.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this picture is not about brutality of Delhi Police
content: Amid a plethora of photos and videos related to the Delhi riots going viral, a recent image shows a policeman trying to hit a young boy with a baton. It is being claimed that this is how the Delhi Police tackle terror. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim with the photo to be misleading.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video of police lathi-charge is not from Delhi
content: Amid the tension in North-East Delhi following the violence, social media is flooded with several videos of vandalism and police action. While some videos have links with the recent incidents of Delhi, a few of them are old and unrelated.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This story about woman falling from Eiffel Tower is too good to be true
content: A picture of a woman kissing an iron girder is going viral on social media with a fascinating story. Text superimposed on the picture says a woman attempted suicide from the Eiffel Tower, landed on a car, survived and later married the owner of the car.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: BR Ambedkar's great-grandson mistakes cattle breed for caste
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim misleading. 'Brahman Pies' has nothing to do with the Indian caste Brahmins, which is also spelt differently. It is a 100% Australian-owned company.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the bike accident video of Tamil actor Ajith Kumar
content: The viral video is a little more than seven years old and not from India.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Before Trump’s visit, slum image from Mumbai passed off as Gujarat on social media
content: A set of two images, claiming to be of Gujarat are going viral on Facebook. One of the images which looks more like a digital graphic has the caption "Gujarat 2014". The other picture shows a top shot of slumlike structures with a caption saying "Gujarat now".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Porn pics used to cook up a story about rape by Indian soldiers
content: The viral news article also carries a photo of a semi-nude girl and an image of a young girl, holding a kid whose face is blurred.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Before US president’s visit, a sensational Trump lookalike video goes viral
content: A small video clip has gone viral on Facebook which claims that Donald Trump is suggestively grabbing bikini-clad women.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of honour killing victim passed off as Pulwama martyr
content: An emotional post has gone viral on social media showing a toddler, in the arms of a woman, touching the photo of a young man in a large frame. It is being claimed that the baby is looking at the photo of his father who was killed in the Pulwama attack. But, what is the truth?
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose’s wife Emilie Schenkl
content: Facebook page“Vijeta Malik BJP” uploaded the woman’s picture, along with a long write-up, claiming that the photo is of Netaji’s wife Emilie.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not believe this hoax about the death of Kobe Bryant’s wife
content: A video on YouTube shows a clip with a “BBC News” logo claiming the death of Vanessa Bryant, the wife of late Kobe Bryant. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the news to be a hoax.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old photo of Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal goes viral with misleading claim
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the photo to be half true. This is an old photo, taken at Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi, on January 26, 2018.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of eviction drive in Odisha passed off as Yogi's Uttar Pradesh
content: The viral video claims that this is how the poor are harassed in Yogi Adityanath's Uttar Pradesh.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of a Sikh procession has nothing to do with Shaheen Bagh
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. The video is three months old and from Sultanpur Lodhi in Punjab.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Amanatullah Khan's tweet doctored to give it communal twist
content: The post which has gone viral on social media claims that Amanatullah Khan hailed the Shaheen Bagh protest and thanked his Muslim brothers and sisters saying 'Islam will win'.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Manoj Tiwari break into tears on TV after knowing Delhi exit poll results?
content: Several Facebook users posted a video of Manoj Tiwari's interview where the emotional Delhi BJP chief can be seen in tears. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Popular story about this historic pic of Gandhi is far from truth
content: A photo showing Mahatma Gandhi with a kid is being circulated on social media with claims that the child is Gandhi's grandson Kanu Gandhi at Dandi March in 1930. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the picture was clicked at Mumbai's Juhu beach in 1937 when Gandhi was convalescing after an illness and was living in RD Birla's bungalow at Juhu.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Old picture of Kejriwal-Imran Khan meet linked to Delhi election
content: A few images of Kejriwal with Imran Khan have gone viral with the claim that the Aam Aadmi Party chief met Imran Khan just before the election.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did police publicly kill coronavirus-infected woman in China?
content: A video showing policemen dragging a woman out of a car and pinning her to the ground is going viral on Facebook with the claim that cops in China publicly killed a lady infected with coronavirus.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this baby Dalai Lama with Mahatma Gandhi?
content: A Facebook user posted a photo of Mahatma Gandhi standing with a kid claiming that the child is spiritual leader Dalai Lama. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the photo to be morphed.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Tarek Fatah passes off old video with communal slogans as recent one from Delhi
content: Amid voting for the Delhi assembly elections on Saturday, a video with communal slogans went viral on social media with the claim that the incident took place in the Capital.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This is turban tying competition from Bathinda, not Shaheen Bagh protest
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim with the photograph to be false. The photo is almost three years old and it is from Punjab's Bathinda.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, China has not sought permission to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be completely false as it is based on a report of a rather suspicious website.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Ahead of Delhi polls, old video of Dilip Ghosh being heckled goes viral with misleading claim
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. The video is from 2017 and Dilip Ghosh was being heckled by Gorkhas in Darjeeling.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: Bloated casualty figures linked to coronavirus leave netizens in panic
content: The claim was originally made by “Hal Turner Radio Show” on January 23.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Did a woman throw dirty water at Arvind Kejriwal?
content: A picture of Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal walking down a narrow alley along with other people is going viral on social media. In the photo, the Aam Aadmi Party leader's shirt appears to be wet, and it is being claimed that a woman threw dirty water at him.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of a man posing as a Muslim woman in burqa is not from Shaheen Bagh
content: A video has gone viral on social media claiming that some men participated in the Shaheen Bagh protests wearing burqas and posing as women. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video is not of Kobe Bryant’s chopper crash
content: The viral video is more than a year old and has no relation to the basketball player’s death.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Rahul Gandhi salute the Tricolour with his left hand?
content: The viral picture has been inverted laterally.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind mother fox feeding koalas during Australia bushfires
content: A video of a red fox breastfeeding has gone viral with the claim that it is feeding baby koalas, and relating it to the bushfires in Australia.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Man attacked with ink and slippers has no relation to either BJP or CAA
content: A video showing a man smearing ink on another man’s face and beating him with slippers is going viral on social media with the claim that the victim is a BJP leader and former Haj committee chairman.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Irfan Pathan was meeting fans in Kolkata, not protesters at Shaheen Bagh
content: A video of former cricketer Irfan Pathan on an open vehicle amid an excited crowd of youngsters is going viral on social media with the claim that he was at Shaheen Bagh to lend support to the protest.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the first time JNU will celebrate Republic Day
content: A viral post claims that JNU is celebrating Republic Day for the first time in 50 years and it has been possible only because of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Will Tata Group not hire from JNU anymore?
content: Facebook user Akhil Kumar wrote a post in Hindi in a group called Helping India Foundation, which translates to, Welcome decision. Tata Company has given azaadi to students of JNU.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video passed off as man in Shaheen Bagh spitting on food for distribution
content: The post claims that the location is Shaheen Bagh in New Delhi and the man is spitting on a ladle of biryani before distributing it to non-Muslims.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Imposter Twitter accounts of Aajtak peddling fake news
content: According to the message attributed to Smriti Irani, the minister apparently said, “Delhi’s government school should not be made a polling booth or else people will vote for Kejriwal after seeing government school.” India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this post to be fake.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Clip of video game passed off as US shooting down Iranian missiles
content: A video clip of rapid gunfire in the night sky with a trail of black smoke has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is how the US military had shot down missiles fired by Iran at an American airbase in Iraq.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Are these 69 siblings from one mother? It's half true
content: A group photograph has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is the family of the world's most prolific mother, who has given birth to 69 babies. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the Russian woman mentioned in the post does hold the world record for having the highest number of children. But the viral image has no connection with her.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Anti-encroachment drive in Jaipur passed off as police action after NRC
content: It is clear that the video of an anti-encroachment drive in Jaipur is being shared as people being evicted from their houses in Assam after NRC.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: False claim saying Modi pays tribute to Godse resurfaces
content: A collage of two photographs is doing the rounds on social media, with the claim that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has paid tribute to the busts of Mahatma Gandhi as well as his killer Nathuram Godse.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: News about four-day working week in Finland is too good to be true
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a misleading post. The Finnish government has denied this claim and categorically said that this issue is not even in the government agenda.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Hilarious video of woman slapping girl goes viral linking it to CAA
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. The viral video is nearly four years old and has no relation to the ongoing anti-CAA stir.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Claims of black ban at Wankhede during India-Australia ODI fall on flat pitch
content: Many have claimed that authorities did not allow spectators dressed in black inside the stadium fearing that it might be used to protest against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Images of fake notes from Telangana go viral linking them to RSS and Gujarat
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the post to be misleading. The images used in the viral post are not from Gujarat but Telangana.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Soleimani’s funeral procession passed off as anti-NRC protest in Delhi
content: An aerial footage showing tens of thousands of people on the street is doing the rounds on Facebook with the claim that it is a rally by Muslims in Delhi against the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR). India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim along with the video to be untrue.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Aishe Ghosh's hand injury is not shifting, the photo is morphed.
content: A collage of two photos — one showing JNUSU President Aishe Ghosh with a bandage on her left hand, and the other with a bandage on the right hand — has been going viral on social media. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the second image has been flipped to mislead.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Is Indira Gandhi posing with her husband and father-in-law in this photo?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Indira Gandhi enter JNU with police and force Sitaram Yechury to apologise?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the picture is not from JNU but was taken from outside the residence of Indira Gandhi.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: These images of US soldiers' coffins don't show Iran's revenge
content: The photos showed coffins of American soldiers killed in the recent missile attack by Iran on US forces in Iraq.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Akbaruddin Owaisi is not pleading for help because of Amit Shah
content: The viral post is a collage of two videos — the first of his controversial statement from 2013 threatening Hindus and the second in which he is seen praying for the well-being of Muslims. The second video is claimed to be from 2019.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of atrocities on women in Jodhpur passed off as plight of Hindus in Pakistan
content: A disturbing video showing two men assaulting a woman and whisking away a girl on a tractor has gone viral on social media with the claim that this is how Hindus are treated in Pakistan.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did this SFI worker fake injuries after violence at JNU?
content: Students' Federation of India activist Soori Krishnan was reportedly injured in the violence at Jawaharlal Nehru University on January 5. His photo with a bandaged head was also published by mainstream media.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Republican Congressman targets Obama on Iran with morphed image
content: The original image is of Obama shaking hands with former Indian Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this the video of US drone strike that killed Iranian general Soleimani?
content: A video has gone viral on social media claiming to be of the very drone attack that killed Soleimani. India Today Anti Fake News War Room has found that the video has nothing to do with Soleimani’s killing.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: This European kid was not beaten up by a Muslim immigrant for having blue eyes
content: A disturbing photo of a child with bruises and stitches below the eyes is going viral on social media with the claim that a 12-year-old Swedish kid was beaten up by a Muslim immigrant for having blue eyes. Our fact check team found out that the claim was false
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Touching image of kangaroo hugging woman has no relation to Australian bush fires
content: The devastating bush fires in Australia have triggered several heart-wrenching images of trapped animals on social media. Several comforting pictures of humans rescuing animals are also available on the Internet.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact check: Nasimuddin Siddiqui targetted for a radical Muslim comment that he didn't make
content: The person saying " “I am a Muslim first and then an Indian” is not Congress leader Nasimuddin Siddiqui.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Are Mamata supporters thrashing this man for favouring NRC in Bengal ?
content: Mamata Banerjee has staunchly opposed the idea of National Register of Citizens and has also led anti-NRC protests in West Bengal.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Did former European Commission prez say Indian voters are foolish?
content: A Facebook post attributing a quote to former European Commission (EC) president Jean-Claude Juncker has gone viral on social media. But is it true?
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Nepali Tiktok stars photo passed off as Finnish ministers
content: Our Fact Check Team revealed that a photo being passed off as Finish ministers on social media are that of Tik Tok stars from Nepal.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of police atrocity is not related to NRC
content: Protests against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act and National Register of Citizens have turned violent in many parts of India. Videos and photos of alleged police atrocities are simultaneously doing the rounds on social media.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this the school bus anti-CAA protesters targeted in Delhi’s Seelampur?
content: A video of a moving bus with shattered windows, wailing children and adults reassuring them is spreading like wildfire on social media, linking it to Tuesday’s violence in Seelampur.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: This little girl was not injured in stone pelting on trains in India
content: In many places across Bengal, anti-CAA protesters set trains and railway stations on fire, vandalised them and uprooted railway tracks.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not ABVP man in the garb of Delhi police
content: The viral claim also has a screenshot of the Facebook profile of “Bharat Sharma” along with the man in civil dress.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image of Egyptian child kidnapper passed off as Jamia protester
content: Several Facebook users have posted the photo, with the claim that he is a student of Jamia, caught arsoning and pelting stones in the disguise of a woman.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Eight-year-old photo passed off as police atrocities on Jamia students
content: Soon after protests against Citizenship Amendment Act turned violent in Delhi's Jamia Nagar area on Sunday, many photos and videos of alleged police atrocities have been doing the rounds on social media.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of little girl crying goes viral with misleading claim
content: The video of the little girl crying has gone viral on social media with the claim that she has been separated from her parents.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check- Incident of a man kidnapped and raped by three women is not from Telangana
content: The FB post says “ The females forced him to consume viagra and energy drinks and as continued taking turns on him for three days before they dumped him in a field of Medak district in Telangana.”
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Photoshopped image passed off as live suicide from Dubai’s Burj Khalifa
content: AFWA has found the claim to be false.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact check: No, lawyers are not exempted at Toll plazas on the national highways
content: AFWA found that there has not been any such exemption given to the advocates by the National Highways Authority of India.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Mainstream media fall for crazy satire story on viagra-filled river
content: AFWA has found this to be a satirical article originally taken from an international website known for publishing fictional stories.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind viral post showing Chinese biz tycoon Jack Ma’s struggle
content: A picture showing four people, including two children and a disabled man, has gone viral on social media, giving the impression that they are not financially too well off.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this Amit Shah touching the feet of Swami Nithyananda?
content: Indian agencies are on the lookout for rape accused Swami Nithyananda who is suspected to have fled the country. Amid this, a photo showing a man touching the feet of the self-styled godman is doing the rounds on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did this man track down and brutally torture his three-year-old daughter's rapist?
content: A photo showing two police officers holding a man has gone on viral on social media with the claim that this South African father chased down his three-year-old daughter's rapist and brutally tortured him.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This viral video has nothing to do with Hyderabad vet’s last rites
content: The video was shared on a Facebook group called Naveen Pattnaik Fan Club.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: PM Modi's image photoshopped along with starving woman from Africa
content: A collage of two images, one showing Prime Minister Narendra Modi eating from a lavish spread, juxtaposed with another picture of a starving woman with a rickety child, has gone viral on Facebook.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Rumours take venomous wings, turns butterfly into dreaded killer
content: According to the claim 150 people killed in three days after being bitten by a butterfly with snake-head wings
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Is Bill Gates the son of a woodcutter?
content: Several Facebook users have made the same claim believing it to be a true inspirational story from the life of the Microsoft founder.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Morphed image of soccer stars goes viral with ‘Pray for Gaza’ message
content: Have international soccer stars Cristiano Ronaldo, Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Mohamed Salah expressed solidarity with the people of Gaza by bandaging an eye?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral photo of cyclist on temple wall is not from India
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral photo is not from the said Tamil Nadu temple.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Misleading comparison between Statue of Unity and Taj Mahal goes viral
content: The Statue of Unity, dedicated to Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, was inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Gujarat last year. At 182 metres, it is the world’s tallest statue. However, there has been criticism from various quarters over the amount of money spent to build the monument.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral photo of bling funeral is not of Kuwait's richest man
content: A Facebook user posted nine pictures with the caption, "The richest man in Kuwait Nassi Al Kharki has passed away..." India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the man in the coffin was actually a millionaire real estate mogul from Trinidad and Tobago. Also, as claimed in the post, "Nassi Al Kharki" is not the richest man in Kuwait.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No this is not the funeral picture of Indira Gandhi
content: The viral picture showing Rajiv Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi is from “Frontier Gandhi’s” last rites and not of India Gandhi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: All that glitters is not Diwali
content: A graphic image is being shared on social media with the claim that it is the night view of an illuminated India captured by NASA during Diwali.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Was BJP leader Pankaja Munde in tears after losing in Maharashtra polls?
content: As Maharashtra Assembly results were declared on Thursday, social media users claimed that BJP candidate Pankaja Munde, who was contesting from Parli assembly constituency, burst out crying after losing. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that this particular image of Pankaja is from October 20.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Old image of Devendra Fadnavis feasting goes viral amid PMC bank crisis
content: Facebook page "Siyasat Siyasat" posted a picture of the Maharashtra chief minister having food along with some others. An array of food items and fruits are laid out on the table in front of him. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this post to be misleading. This image of Fadnavis is at least three years old.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Japan construct this bridge in 24 hours?
content: It’s no news that Japan is a technological superpower. But is it possible that Japanese engineers would have built a complex bridge in just 24 hours? At least that’s what social media claims.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral videos of leopards attacking dogs in residential apartments are not from Mumbai
content: Facebook users have shared videos of leopards entering residential apartments and attacking dogs after number of trees were cut in Aarey Colony of Mumbai. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that two of those videos are not from Mumbai.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Karti Chidambaram posts unrelated image from Scotland with plogging pics of PM Modi
content: A recent video of Prime Minister Narendra Modi cleaning Tamil Nadu’s Mamallapuram beach has initiated mixed response among netizens. While many appreciate the PM for the hands-on job, others call it a staged PR exercise executed with the help of a planned photoshoot.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind viral post of the largest snake killed in Amazon
content: Did Africa’s Royal British commandos kill the world’s largest anaconda which was 134 feet long and weighed more than 2,000 kilos? Did they take 37 days to kill the snake that had devoured over 250 humans and 2,300 animals?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of teargas shelling is not from Kashmir but Jakarta
content: Recently a video of tear gas shelling by police has gone viral on Facebook with the claim that it is from Kashmir. However, the video is not from Kashmir but from Jakarta, Indonesia.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, banks are not on an extended 7-day holiday
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the number of holidays listed in the post is not true. While the bank strike has been called off, it is not a holiday on September 30.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Photoshopped image of Arabs protesting against PM Modi goes viral
content: Did people in Saudi Arabia protest against Prime Minister Narendra Modi by showing shoes? An image of a few Arabs protesting with shoes in hands and purportedly holding placards of PM Modi has gone viral on Facebook.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Gujarat is not only state to reduce fines under amended Motor Vehicles Act
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that Gujarat is not the only state to have slashed fines while implementing the amended MVA. Uttarakhand has also done it, while Karnataka is actively considering the same.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Do not believe this bizarre story of Marilyn Monroe’s X-ray
content: An X-ray image of chest with a cockroach is being widely shared on social media. Users claim that the X-ray image is of a man from Zimbabwe who was advised to go to India to get himself treated. What is the truth?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Blog claims man choked to death on rasgulla celebrating ISRO’s failure to contact Vikram
content: Did a Bangladeshi man choke to death from hot rasgulla while celebrating ISRO’s failure to contact Vikram lander?
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Maharashtra elections not announced yet, but schedule goes viral
content: Many social media users claimed that the Election Commission of India (ECI) has declared the dates for Assembly polls in Maharashtra. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the dates for the upcoming elections in Maharashtra have not yet been declared.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Don’t believe this sob story of AIIMS doctor and his magic pill for obesity
content: An audacious claim about a magic pill for weight loss had gone viral on the Internet. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the claim of “AIIMS doctor discovering a shockingly simple way to lose 1 kg per day” is totally fake.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these policemen are not fighting for traffic challan money
content: A video where two policemen are seen hitting each other with wooden batons has gone viral. Netizens claim the cops are fighting over distribution money collected from slapping penalties. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. Two constables of UP police fought each other on issues related to their duties and responsibilities.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this 90-year-old man unable to bury son's body due to Kashmir lockdown?
content: The post has been shared more than 8,200 times and the video has received around one lakh views.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of police lathi charging has no connection with new Motor Vehicles Act
content: The video shows some policemen with batons (lathis) in their hands, thrashing people on the road and taking them in a police jeep.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this little boy crossing into Jordan alone after losing his family in Syria war?
content: Many Facebook users claimed that a four-year-old boy was migrating alone from Syria to Jordan when a UNHCR team found him. However, India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. This is a five-year-old picture. The boy was indeed migrating from Syria, but he was not alone and was moving with a group of people.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Are sea turtles making beeline for Mumbai beach after cleanup?
content: Many social media users are claiming that clean beaches have led to sea turtles laying eggs along the Mumbai beach this week. However, India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that an incident of a single sea turtle laying eggs did happen last year, but no such incident has taken place this week or even this year.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Don't believe this picture of Ranu Mandal meeting Lata Mangeshkar
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false. Lata Mangeshkar never met Ranu Mandal. The thumbnail picture of Lata Mangeshkar blessing Ranu Mandal is photoshopped and the viral video is doctored.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Does physicist HC Verma donate Rs 1 crore to PM relief fund?
content: Facebook page 'Work For Unity' has shared an image of HC Verma, claiming that he receives Rs one crore as royalty every year for his book 'Concepts of Physics', which he donates to the PM relief fund and for charity.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact check: Viral pic of Chimpanzee hugging a man is not from Amazon rain forest
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim. The viral picture has no connection with the recent Amazon forest fire, neither it is from the Amazon rain forest.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this woman was not shot by the Indian Army and she is not a Kashmiri
content: A disturbing video, in which a woman is seen bleeding profusely, is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that “Indian Army shot down a Kashmiri student”.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Delhi Youth Congress shares misleading video of mob lynching on social media
content: Social media users shared a video of a mob brutally thrashing a man in the middle of a market and claimed that the video is of a man being beaten to death for not buying headphones that he bargained for in Old Delhi. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral video has nothing to do with the Old Delhi incident.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Scripted video of police atrocities in Pakistan passed off as Kashmir
content: A video has surfaced over the internet which shows a few men with black t-shirts, with 'POLICE' written on them, and faces covered assaulting women and children and ransacking a house.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Indian forces did not burn alive a protestor in Srinagar
content: Twitter account 'Khaleej Mag' posted a video of a burning man running in presence of policemen and claimed that it was a Kashmiri protestor set on fire by Indian forces.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of mudslide is not from India
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is not from India.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Don't fall for Domino's anniversary offer of free pizza
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the post is not genuine. There is no such offer from Domino's.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: British politician shares 9-year-old video to target Indian Army
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is more than nine years old.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Harassment of Muslim women in Sri Lanka passed off as atrocities by RSS
content: The six-month-old video was posted by Facebook user 'Muhammed Asif Shirva', who claimed, "RSS_groups torchering (torturing) Muslim college girls".
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Old doctored video blaming Modi for Pulwama resurfaces as Pakistanis left red-faced on Kashmir
content: A video of Pakistani YouTuber ‘Doctor Turki’ has resurfaced on social media, who claims to have exposed a “leaked call recording of Modi” on Pulwama. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be baseless.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan minister tries to pass off lathicharge on Ram Rahim supporters as atrocities in Kashmir
content: On August 18, Ali Haider Zaidi, federal minister for maritime affairs in Pakistan, tweeted a video of police lathicharge, claiming that it depicts atrocities on women in Kashmir. India Today Anti Fake news War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be totally false.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did BJP open its unit in Balochistan?
content: A video is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that BJP has opened its unit in Pakistan’s Balochistan. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video was shot during the general election 2019 in Anantnag, Jammu & Kashmir.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Now JD(U) leader falls for best national anthem hoax
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found JDU leader Ajay Alok's claim that Jana Mana Gana has been declared best national anthem by Unesco to be false. This false claim has been viral on Internet for years.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Italy's Republic Day ceremony passed off as India's I-Day celebration in London
content: As India celebrated its 73rd Independence Day on Thursday, a video of jets performing an air show has gone viral on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Take this one with a heap of salt
content: A picture of a child covered in a heap salt is spreading across social media, with the claim that a drowned person can revive if covered in salt for up to four hours. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be absolutely false.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Bangladesh site uses old image of Pak Army, social media claims they are charging towards India
content: On August 6, Facebook page ‘Dr. Zubaida Rahman’ wrote a post in Bengali which translates to, “Pakistani Army is charging towards the Kashmir border. As the war cry intensifies, Indian soldiers deployed in Kashmir Valley are scared. India has deployed an additional 20,000 soldiers to check the retreat of its soldiers.” Is this true?
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact check: Viral images of Kashmiris smiling at security forces are years old
content: India Today Anti Fake News War room (AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Konkan Railway didn’t cancel train services due to landslide
content: One Facebook user posted an image of a landslide-affected railway track and claimed that it is from Karwar in the Konkan region. He further claimed that due to the incident, Konkan Railway cancelled all trains. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Manmohan say Congress will pay heavily for protesting govt’s move on J&K?
content: The message claimed that Singh said the Congress will have to pay a huge price like staying away from power for years for going against the NDA government’s decision on J&K.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video from Kashmir shared as protest against revocation of Article 370
content: Facebook user FB News TV uploaded the protest video with a caption in Hindi that translates to, Thousands of Kashmiris protested on the streets of occupied Kashmir to free their land.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: No, PM Modi was not watching the Imran Khan-Donald Trump meet on the big screen
content: Avideo of Prime Minister Narendra Modi watching the live broadcast of Imran Khan-Donald Trump meet on a big screen started doing the rounds on social media. The 44-second-long video was shared by Facebook page 'Tangi Pti Official'.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Pak media share old house arrest video of Geelani as recent one
content: The 45-second-long video clip shows Geelani's men trying to open a door seemingly locked from outside. Geelani is seen talking to security personnel posted outside through a small opening on the door.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Indian Army didn’t burn down houses in Kashmir
content: A video has gone viral on Facebook with the claim that Indian Army burnt down houses of Kashmiris in Bandipora district of J&K. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that neither is the video from Bandipora, nor did the Indian Army burn down the houses.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind Pakistan soldiers carrying white flag as Indian jawan watches over
content: Social media is ripe with rumours over the developments. One such Facebook post in Bengali claims that Pakistani soldiers, waving white flags, sought truce with Indian jawans. The photo, along with the post, shows an Indian soldier watching over as some Pakistani forces stand with a white flag in hand.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Wait, don't fall for advertisements already selling land in Srinagar
content: Though the new development on principal allows any citizen of the country to buy property in J&K, but these advertisements posted on social media are hoaxes.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not Hima Das’s family celebrating her win
content: A video has surfaced on social media apparently showing members of Hima Das’s family reacting after she won a gold medal. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be untrue.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Sunita Williams convert to Islam?
content: Facebook user M Rahman posted a video which apparently explains why Sunita Williams decided to accept Islam. Along with the video, he wrote a post in Bengali, which when translated, stated, "This is why Sunita Williams accepted Islam right after returning from space."
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Was this Muslim man flogged in a crowded stadium in India?
content: Picture of security personnel publicly flogging a man tied to a wooden frame is being shared on social media as an example of atrocities on Muslims in India.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: Does this flower bloom every 36 years? Know the truth behind Nagapushpa
content: The claim about Nagapushpa blooming every 36 years in the Himalayas is wrong
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Bonhomie between Jews and Arabs in viral video is misleading
content: A video has gone viral on Facebook with the claim that Arabs and Jews were dancing together to celebrate the opening of Israeli and Saudi Arabian embassies in each other’s countries. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Photo showing school students sitting in open amidst filth is not from Gujarat
content: A viral photo, where students are sitting in the open amidst filth, also claims that the government spends Rs 4,000 crore on Kumbh festival but spends Rs 400 crore on education in the country.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: The emotional story behind this photo is fake
content: AFWA found that the whole story with the photo is cooked up. There is no relationship between the policewoman and the old lady. Therefore, the claim that the old woman has worked so hard to secure the future of her granddaughter is also false.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this disturbing video of a youth being thrashed is not from any Kendriya Vidyalaya
content: The 72-second video that has been doing the rounds on Facebook and Twitter shows a man lying face down on the ground, and several young boys thrashing him with sticks and bricks ruthlessly.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Russian rocket crash passed off as Iran's failure
content: Netizens have claimed that the rocket belonged to Iran and sarcastically commented that it’s the best the country has produced so far. The video spread like wildfire on Facebook.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Did PM Modi send his chopper to ferry Dera chief Ram Rahim?
content: A collage of two pictures has been doing the rounds on social media claiming that PM Modi sent his helicopter to ferry rape convict Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral image of man saving calf on his shoulder is not from Assam
content: The picture was posted on Facebook on July 19, 2019 and has been shared by more than 4,000 users till the time of writing this article.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact check: Is this lion roaming free on the streets of Mumbai?
content: A video in which a lion coolly walks around and crosses a busy street, even as motorists try to avoid crashing on it, has been going viral on social media. But a few social media users like Karan Patel claimed that the video was from Mumbai, Aarey road.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Know the truth behind Owaisi’s claim about freedom fighters’ names on India Gate
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi, recently at a political rally, claimed that there were names of 95,300 freedom fighters written on India Gate, out of which, 61,945 names are of Muslims.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of 2013 Thane building crash goes viral as that of Mumbai’s Dongri
content: A video of a building collapse is going viral on social media with users claiming that the dramatic visuals are from the July 16 disaster in Mumbai’s Dongri area.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ slogans by MP Madrasa students
content: A video, apparently showing school children shouting ‘Pakistan Zindabad’, has gone viral on social media. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the students were not shouting ‘Pakistan Zindabad’ but ‘Saabir Sahab Zindabad’.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this video of fishermen drowning is not from Mumbai
content: Many social media users have claimed that a video of a fishing trawler turning turtle in the choppy seawaters is of sea storm near Uran Mora, a fishing village in Navi Mumbai.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Anti-lynching protest in Surat goes viral as vandalism in Mumbai
content: A video of some hooligans smashing a blue-coloured bus has been going viral with the claim that it is the doing of some auto-rickshaw drivers in the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) area of Mumbai. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the video is not from Mumbai but from Surat.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Did this cameraman cry after Dhoni’s dismissal against New Zealand?
content: An emotional post is viral on Internet claiming that even the cameraman on the ground couldn’t stop himself and cried on Dhoni’s dismissal. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan YouTuber instigates communal hatred with false facts
content: YouTuber named "Veer" posted a video where he claimed that a Christian woman police officer has been thrashed and paraded naked in India by the "Saffron Hindus". India Today Anti Fake News War room ( AFWA) found this to be a completely misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Shanghai police drill video goes viral as shooting of three Uyghur Muslims
content: India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video has nothing to do with extremism.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Bengal police thrash a man for saying “Jai Shri Ram”?
content: A video of police brutality has gone viral on social media where a police officer is seen thrashing a chained man in front of other policemen and the man can be heard shouting “Jai Bajrang Bali”. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this filthy flight was not carrying Indian Haj pilgrims
content: A video of a dirty aircraft cabin has gone viral on social media with the claim that it is an “Air India flight with Hajis”. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. The viral video is not of any Air India flight with Haj pilgrims.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Jalna video of motorcycle falling inside a big pothole goes viral as being from Mumbai
