content: A viral video showed a motorcycle being pulled out of a water-filled ‘pothole’ in Mumbai. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found out that the video is not from Mumbai but from Jalna district of Maharashtra, which is about 400 km away from state’s capital.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Old tampered video of Muharram goes viral with anti-RSS slogan
content: India Today Anti Fake News War room ( AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim. The original video is of a Muharram procession of 2017 and devoid of any such slogan. The original audio has been tampered, while the slogan is overlaid on the viral video.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Nirmala Sitharaman claim distributing 35,000 crore LED bulbs?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that Sitharaman never said that 35,000 crore LED bulbs were distributed in the country in her speech. In fact, she said that approximately 35 crore LED bulbs were distributed under the Ujala scheme.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Picture of handcuffed woman in burqa goes viral with wrong claim
content: The woman in the viral picture was not arrested because of wearing a burqa but due to her alleged involvement with terror organisation Islamic State.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of Modi-Manmohan meet goes viral with misleading claim
content: A video of Modi meeting the former PM is going viral on social media with the claim that it signals the critical condition of India’s economy.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this woman with a kid was not thrashed by police in UP
content: In one picture, the woman is seen pointing towards something that cannot be seen in the frame, while in both photos, a small girl standing next to her is seen crying.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Canadian PM Justin Trudeau is not converting to Islam
content: Trudeau is not converting to Islam. The reference article is three years old and taken from a satirical website.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Photoshopped image of Kapil Sibal and his wife inside slaughterhouse goes viral
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the viral picture of Kapil Sibal and his wife inside a slaughterhouse is photoshopped. The original picture was first published in The Washington Post in 2007, in an article on a French female butcher, Stephanie Gerbier.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of Bangladesh goes viral with false communal spin
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the video is two years old and not from India, but neighbouring Bangladesh. This incident is a fallout of Bangladesh's internal political rivalry and there was nothing communal about it. Two people, Abu Sayyed, and Mohammed Ali - the alleged murderer of a Bangladeshi politician were being thrashed up by people.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: “Like father, like son”: Netizens slam Kailash Vijayvargiya over old photo, but truth is something else
content: While the incident involving Akash Vijayvargiya is well known by now, many on social media and even some media organisations have fallen for the photo which does not show what it looks like at first glance.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Iceland is not giving money to immigrants to marry its women
content: India Today's Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a hoax.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Volcanic ash-covered lake goes viral as Arabian desert
content: India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found it to be a wrong claim. This is not a visual of Allen Alkhai desert, but Lake Nahuel Huapi in Argentina which was filled with ash from the Puyehue-Cordon Caulle volcano of Chile in 2011.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim of elderly Brahmin man being stripped and humiliated is wrong
content: Dev Oza’s post was re-tweeted 3,770 times and liked by more than 3,000 users at the time of filing this story.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Assault video from Lucknow goes viral with misleading communal narrative
content: A post by Facebook user 'R Madhu Sahu' claims that some Muslim men tried to rape the woman in Lucknow's Itaunja area and beat her up along with her brother when the two resisted. The message urged Hindus to rise and claimed that police have not registered an FIR in the incident. India Today's Anti Fake News War room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind viral pic of Big B lending hand to stretcher to carry a body
content: A viral post on social media claims, Amitabh’s servant who was working with him for the last 40 years died
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Gory video of man with severed head goes viral on social media with wrong claim
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a misleading claim. The beheading incident took place last year in Karnataka and it has nothing to do with rape.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post warning Mumbai residents of robbers is a hoax
content: A viral social media post claims that a group of 15-20 miscreants are on the loose in Mumbai and asks residents not to open their doors at night if they hear a baby crying outside. The post claims that the message has been received from Dahisar senior police inspector Ramkant Patil.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Pak PM's aide made a gaffe by claiming the picture of Sachin Tendulkar as of Imran Khan
content: Recently, Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan sowed discord on the internet and became a victim of internet trolling for attributing a quote of Rabindranath Tagore to Kahlil Gibran.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Indian Navy tweets old photo of personnel doing yoga
content: A day before the fifth International Yoga Day, the Indian Navy spokesperson tweeted a pleasing picture with the hashtag #InternationalDayofYoga in which a group of people can be seen performing yoga at a beach during sunset. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the picture tweeted by the Indian Navy spokesperson is of last year’s International Yoga Day.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: To eat or not to eat lychee
content: Many on Facebook and WhatsApp are circulating a message along with a video asking people, particularly children, to stop eating lychee. They claim eating the fruit might cause a life-threatening fever to children, which is "incurable".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not an ancient Bible that was found undersea
content: A Facebook post went on to claim that an ancient copy of the Bible has been discovered undersea in a legible condition. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim is completely false.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Simulation of underwater volcanic explosion passed off as Mount Sinabung eruption
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video showing a series of underwater explosions which leads to a huge plume of thick ash, is an animation which was made by a geologist to show underwater volcanic eruption just off the coast of New Zealand. It has nothing to do with the Indonesian eruption.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind US woman giving birth to 17 identical boys in single pregnancy
content: The viral post was shared by Richard Camarinta Dy on May 30. It has already been shared by more than 33,000 users at the time of filing this story.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these school children are not touching the feet of an Indian soldier
content: A video of school children touching the feet of a soldier is going viral on social media, and users ‘hope’ that stone pelters in Kashmir behave the same way. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found it to be a misleading claim. The viral video is not from India, but Sri Lanka.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: An old meme resurfaces with a new twist on India-Pak match
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral photograph that shows protesters holding a banner saying, “We Don’t Want Kashmir, Give Us Virat Kohli”, is doctored. Everything is the same in the original photo except the text on the banner which reads: “We Want Azaadi”.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan cricket fans use two-day old video to bash up team after loss to India
content: India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the night-out was not before the match but two days prior to it, i.e. Friday, June 14.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Netizens slam author Tarek Fatah for calling Inzamam ‘13th Man, a Mullah’ on Twitter
content: Just a day before the iconic India-Pakistan Cricket World Cup match, author Tarek Fatah had tweeted a picture saying that Pakistan captain Sarfaraz Ahmed has brought out "their 13th Man, a Mullah to bless the pitch for tomorrow's match against India".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral message claiming Kiran Bedi as new Governor of J&K is false
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the viral message is totally false. Kiran Bedi has been serving as the Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry since May 2016.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Doctor attacked in Kolkata’s NRS hospital is doing fine, his death is a hoax
content: Junior doctor Paribaha Mukhopadhyay and Yash Tekwani are the victims who got beaten up at the NRS medical college, Kolkata and it is claimed that Paribaha Mukhopadhyay has passed away.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, banks are not going to have five-day week
content: Will banks remain closed every Saturday from now on?
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not a photo of Cyclone Vayu
content: AFWA did a reverse search of the photo and found that it is an old one.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Are Londoners dancing to Bhojpuri number 'Lollypop Lagelu' during World Cup?
content: A video of foreigners dancing on the popular Bhojpuri number 'Lollypop Lagelu' is driving the social media crazy. Twitter users claimed that it was because of Indians reaching London for ICC Cricket World Cup 2019 that this song was being played.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these are not RJD MLAs dancing with a woman in an objectionable manner
content: Did RJD MLAs from Bihar dance in a questionable manner with a woman while on study tour to Manipur on government expenses?
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these students were not arrested in Kolkata on their way to terror training
content: A viral video on social media claims that a group of children were arrested from Muslim-dominated Rajabazar in Kolkata while they were being taken to Pune for terror training. India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral photo of atrocities on this woman is not related to love jihad
content: India Today's Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the photo is related to a case of domestic violence in Pakistan's Lahore.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Was this man given death penalty for becoming Robin Hood?
content: This emotional post has caught everyone's eye on social media.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind the news of 250 passengers' murders by a Muslim taxi driver
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the incident is at least 12 years old.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: 1-year-old dance video of Lalu's sons goes viral with misleading claim
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room found that the video was recorded more than a year ago and has no relation with the election results.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Old video of Farooq Abdullah shouting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' goes viral with wrong claim
content: A short video clip of National Conference (NC) president and senior Jammu and Kashmir leader Farooq Abdullah is going viral both on Facebook and Twitter.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Army dogs did not maul a stone pelter in Kashmir
content: The incident took place in Morocco and not Kashmir as claimed.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: What is the truth behind this viral message of horrible rape case in Delhi?
content: The message with the viral photo says that an Assamese girl from Delhi University has been raped and killed in Delhi.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: The truth behind a Tokyo restaurant serving human meat
content: A Facebook post is being shared widely with the claim that a restaurant in Japan is serving human meat.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Bhajan kirtans part of Ram Navami processions in Srinagar since 2007
content: Bhajan kirtans have been organised in Srinagar since 2007, as part of Ram Navami celebrations.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral picture of Muslim man being heckled is not from India
content: The image neither has any relation with India nor with the BJP and is a six-year-old picture from an incident in neighboring Bangladesh.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Photos of Japan anti-nuclear protest passed off as Zakir Musa’s funeral
content: Many Facebook users have taken to the social media platform, posting an image of a gathering of thousands of people, and claiming it to be from Musa’s funeral.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Modi hasn't announced countywide prohibition order
content: A screen grab of Aajtak news channel is being circulated with the claim that Prime Minister Modi has announced liquor ban in the country from tonight. The image, which bears the logo of Aajtak channel, is photoshopped.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Jagan Mohan Reddy has not changed his religion
content: A few Facebook users posted a video of Jagan Mohan Reddy observing some Hindu rituals, claiming that he has converted to Hinduism. The YSRCP chief is a Christian by faith.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: Amartya Sen never said he preferred watching cartoon than Modi’s oath-taking ceremony
content: Amartya Sen has never said in any interview that he preferred watching cartoon than Modi’s swearing-in ceremony.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral money shower video has no link to PM Modi's election victory celebration
content: The video was actually produced by American music artist Joe Kush and posted a week before the election results were declared.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this crying candidate didn’t get only five votes
content: The video shows Jalandhar candidate Neetu Shutteran Wala tearing up on getting just five votes which is fewer than the nine members of his family. He then begins crying during a conversation with a reporter.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Rahul Gandhi hasn’t won Wayanad seat by highest votes
content: It is being claimed by some people on social media that Rahul Gandhi won Wayanad by the highest number of votes in this election.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim of EVMs being stolen in UP's Chandauli is false
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room has found the claim to be untrue. Even the Election Commission has stated that the reason for the commotion in Chandauli was baseless.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Manish Sisodia's tweet on EVM incident in Jhansi is misleading
content: Manish Sisodia in his claim mentioned five places, including Jhansi, where EVM machines were allegedly replaced.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: No, these EVMs in Bihar were not meant for rigging polls
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room found the claims to be misleading as those EVMs were not used during the voting process for the 2019 election. Instead, they were deployed only for training purposes ahead of counting.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: Doctored video links soccer celebrations in UK to exit poll cheer
content: The original video is of England fans celebrating during a football match shown on a giant screen in Ashton Gate stadium in 2016.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Arun Jaitley use navy chopper to ferry his family in Goa?
content: Many Facebook users have accused Finance Minister Arun Jaitley for misusing a navy helicopter for personal use. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this to be a misleading claim.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: These viral photos have nothing to do with Vidyasagar's statue vandalism
content: Some pictures went viral on social media claiming that CCTV footage revealed Muslim TMC workers vandalised the statue of Vidyasagar.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This video of boy being thrashed has nothing to do with West Bengal
content: In the video, a young boy is seen tied to a tree and some men are beating him with belts. It is being claimed that the boy was beaten up for hoisting a saffron flag atop his house.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, India Today has not released any exit poll data
content: Data being shown in a viral video is dummy data put out by the media house as a promo.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Shivraj Singh Chouhan falls for misleading video of Rahul Gandhi
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is misleading. The viral video is edited in such a way that it gives an impression that Rahul Gandhi is taking incorrect names of MP and Chhattisgarh chief ministers.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video of street play claiming to be of TMC candidate goes viral
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found this to be a false claim. The woman in the video is not a TMC candidate. The video clip is part of a street play.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did a Gujarat BJP MLA beat up Dalit boy for buying new car?
content: India Today Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) has found that Delhi MP Udit Raj's claim that Gujarat BJP MLA Anil Upadhyaya and his goons had beaten up a Dalit boy for buying a new car is totally false. There is no BJP MLA by the name of Anil Upadhyaya in Gujarat.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Could Modi have used a digital camera and email in 1988?
content: India Today's Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that Modi's claim regarding the use of digital camera and email in 1988 cannot be substantiated with credible facts.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Misleading picture of cow deaths goes viral again on social media
content: India Today Anti fake News War Room (AFWA) found that this is a misleading claim. Though there are news reports of cows’ death in several cow shelters in Rajasthan, this particular viral image is not from Rajasthan but from Kenya, East Africa.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the swansong of Lata Mangeshkar
content: A viral Facebook post claiming that Lata Mangeshkar had chosen to stop recording new songs is incorrect
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Gurugram Congress shares misleading video on 'Modi's beautician'
content: India Today’s Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is of March 2016.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Washington Post did not publish cartoon making fun of Rahul Gandhi
content: India Today Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false and the original illustration has been photoshopped to make fun of Rahul Gandhi.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Beware! This viral image of Tricolour burning is not from India
content: Even though the viral post does not mention the name of the place, several people reacted strongly believing it to be from India.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Is it Kangana Ranaut vs Shabana Azmi once again? Not really!
content: As the holy month of Ramzan began on May 5, a hot debate took centrestage on social media, pitting Kangana Ranaut against veteran actor Shabana Azmi on communal lines.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Congress never promised that it will waive off bills of patients who die in hospitals
content: India Today Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) has found that no such promise was made by Congress.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Will Shabana Azmi leave India if PM Modi returns to power?
content: Shabana Azmi has been actively voicing her opinion against the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and was until recently campaigning for CPI candidate Kanhaiya Kumar from Begusarai in Bihar.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral photos of huge BJP crowd not from Azamgarh
content: India Today's Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) has found that these pictures are not from Azamgarh but Odisha and was taken when the election was not even announced.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Is this Tej Bahadur Yadav having booze in the viral video?
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has confirmed that Yadav is present in the video. But this video is more than two years old, according to Yadav.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim of boy dying due to birthday bumps is false
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found in the investigation that the death claim is wrong. India Today spoke directly to the boy and he is absolutely fine.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Don't trust this good news about Naveen Patnaik
content: According to an "exit poll report" doing the rounds on social media, as many as five media organisations and survey agencies have predicted more than two-third majority for Naveen Patnaik's party in the recently-concluded assembly elections after a post-poll survey.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: How actor Saurabh Shukla's picture was used on misleading post on Balakot
content: India Today Anti Fake News Room (AFWA) couldn't find any such statement made by Shukla publicly, and the actor has also denied making this claim.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Viral video showing Muslims protesting crackdown by Sri Lanka after blasts is false
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false, as the viral video has no relation with the recent attacks. This is a video of a protest that happened in 2013 in London.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Know the truth behind Sadhvi Pragya's 'controversial statement'
content: According to a viral post, Sadhvi said Manohar Parrikar died of cancer because he allowed the consumption of beef in Goa; India Today Anti-Fake News Room (AFWA) couldn't find any such statement made by Sadhvi publicly.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi jumps the gun, says Modi govt approves shooting of tribals
content: The proposed changes in the forest law are just at the consultation level at present.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim of Ambedkar statue damaged by BJP MLA is misleading
content: This was posted on Facebook on April 6, 2019, just few days before the Lok Sabha poll. India Today Anti Fake News War Room ( AFWA) found this to be a misleading claim. This was a one year old incident and nobody in the name of Karni Singh, as BJP MLA was related to this incident.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Viral claim comparing nominations of Rahul Gandhi and Modi is misleading
content: A set of viral photos claims that Rahul Gandhi is sitting while handing over the nomination paper to the officer; photo tries to show Rahul Gandhi has no respect towards the concerned officer as compared to PM Modi.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Man in viral video inside polling booth is from TMC and not BJP
content: The video is from Islampur in West Bengal and the man seen in the white kurta is a local Trinamool leader.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Photos passed off as images of Sri Lanka Easter attack victims are actually 13 years old
content: India Today TV's Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) did a reverse search of these images and found both of them are actually from 2006.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: The truth behind Mamata’s appeal to ‘vote for BJP’
content: A video of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has gone viral on social media, claiming that she has urged people to vote for the BJP.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: CIA survey on Indian poll results is a hoax
content: The first hint that the message is fake lies in the headline itself, which has a glaring grammatical error.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: The truth behind viral video where Modi calls himself son of Pathan
content: India Today's Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the video is misleading. A part of the speech is being spread without context.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: BBC never called BJP the most corrupt party in the world
content: India Today Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this claim to be totally false; the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) has neither published these data nor conducted any such survey.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact check: False claim links Kiran Bedi's viral pic with Indira Gandhi's 'car-towing' incident
content: A throwback picture of retired IPS officer Kiran Bedi, along with former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, has gone viral. Several Facebook pages and users have used it as a political weapon to hit out at Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Mehbooba Mufti, senior journalists are wrong on Sadhvi Pragya’s age
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that this claim is not true. Sadhvi Pragya was already an adult in 1992.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: How Rahul Gandhi's translator gave armour to opponents
content: AFWA found that the viral video has been skilfully edited to make it look funnier.
author: Ratna India Today

title: Fact Check: Road in Morocco passed off as Char Dham expressway
content: India Today's AFWA, after investigation, concluded that the image in question does not belong to Char Dham expressway at all.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post claiming Google CEO Sundar Pichai cast his vote in India is fake
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai holds American citizenship, and therefore, he is not allowed to cast his vote in Indian elections.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Video showing Amit Shah insulting LK Advani is misleading
content: The video has been mischievously edited to show Amit Shah directing LK Advani to go at the back.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Execution story of US prisoner is not authentic
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the post is not authentic.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of EVM burning is not from ongoing Lok Sabha polls
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading. This video or the incident is not from the ongoing Lok Sabha polls but of a by-election that took place in Jammu and Kashmir in 2017.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth about this viral photo targeting Rahul Gandhi
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the Facebook post claiming Rahul Gnadhi was sitting as he filed his nomination is false.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Viral Facebook post alleges EVM tampering in Madhya Pradesh. Here’s the truth
content: India Today’s Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the post refers to an old incident and is misleading.

title: Fact Check: Misleading Facebook post of 'Pakistani flags' in BJP rally goes viral
content: A few days back, social media was abuzz with a similar claim that “Pakistan flags” were waved in Rahul Gandhi’s rally in Kerala’s Wayanad, the second seat the Congress president is contesting.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Shabana Azmi's controversial tweet is not completely fake
content: India Today’s Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that during Navratri in 2017, Shabana Azmi did make a similar remark. This has been pointed out by many in the comment section of her tweet.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this viral photograph has no link with Kanhaiya Kumar's poll campaign
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be completely false.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This hilarious video has nothing to do with election campaign
content: A video, currently doing the rounds on Facebook, shows a man tripping badly and then landing on his head while he tries to hop on a camel. The video is being shared far and wide with different claims. Some have claimed that the man who fell from the camel's back is Rajasthan BJP leader Harish Singh.
author: Balkrishna India Today

title: Fact Check: The truth behind Yogi Adityanath's 'cash-for-vote' video
content: India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the video to be false.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral claim about Dhoni joining BJP is false
content: A photo of Mahendra Singh Dhoni with Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah has gone viral on social media, with the claim that Dhoni has joined the BJP and may contest the polls.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: China never shot down an Indian satellite as being claimed
content: A post on Facebook, claiming China shot down an Indian weather satellite in 2012, has been doing rounds on the internet; India Today's Anti-Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Did Wayanad cheer up for Rahul Gandhi waving Pakistan flags?
content: The green flags with a star and a crescent on them are not of Pakistan but of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) -- one of the allies of the United Democratic Front (UDF) in Kerala
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Truth behind photo claiming Jignesh Mevani was beaten up in Begusarai
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this post to be misleading as the picture is from Ahmedabad and was shot in 2018.

title: Fact Check: Is BJP's Shivraj Singh Chouhan going to take on Digvijay Singh in Bhopal?
content: The candidate list viral on social media with Shivraj Singh Chouhan's name is doctored.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Did the judge who acquit Swami Aseemanand in Mecca Masjid blast case join BJP?
content: A photo is doing the rounds on social media with the claim that former NIA judge Ravindra Reddy, who acquitted Swami Aseemanand in the Mecca Masjid blast case, has joined BJP. India Today TV's Anti-Fake News War Room has found that it is fake.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral post on Priyanka Gandhi discussing 2022 polls with workers is misleading
content: A Twitter user 'Chowkidar BALA' claimed that Priyanka is asking workers to prepare for 2022 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections rather than the upcoming polls.

title: No, Mamata Banerjee didn't ask her ministers to not chant Vande Mataram
content: Banerjee was neither seen instructing her party workers to not chant Vande Mataram, nor did she say "Vande Mataram is my foot".

title: Congress spokesperson's claim on veteran BJP leader’s speech is false

author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Facebook post questioning Rahul's arithmetic on NYAY scheme is misleading
content: The viral Facebook video has been constructed stitching together two different parts of the same press conference video.

title: Fact Check: Did Yogi Adityanath celebrate Holi wearing a raincoat?
content: The social media played a rough Holi with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath this time. A picture of the UP chief minister is doing the rounds on Facebook, with the claim that Adityanath was India's first chief minister to have celebrated Holi wearing a raincoat.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of 'conversion' is not related to New Zealand mosque mass shooting
content: Claims are being made that 'conversions' are taking place after Christchurch mosque shootouts.

title: Fact Check: No, NRIs cannot vote online in 2019 Lok Sabha elections
content: A Facebook post claims that the Election Commission of India will allow NRIs to vote online during the 2019 Lok Sabha elections. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be false.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: No, this is not a video of New Zealanders converting to Islam after Christchurch attacks
content: A video started going viral claiming people in New Zealand accepted Islam after Christchurch attacks; India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found the claim to be false as the video is more than 10 years old and it was shot in Germany.
author: Ratna Chakraborty India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Maggi doesn’t contain pig fat
content: The flavour enhancer used by Maggi is a plant product made from beetroot and yeast extracts.

title: Fact Check: Old, controversial story of African lions saving a girl surfaces again
content: A fascinating story of a pride of lions saving an Ethiopian girl from her abductors is doing the rounds on Facebook.

title: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi never said farm produce can be sold to pharma companies
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be misleading.

title: Fact Check: Social media falsely attributes quote to Sir Winston Churchill
content: A quote has been doing rounds on the internet and people are attributing it to Winston Churchill; India Today Anti Fake News War Room found Churchill never said that.

title: Fact Check: Chill. Iceland hasn't declared religions as weapons of mass destruction
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found this claim to be wrong.

title: Fact Check: This video of PM Modi talking about EVM is misleading
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim made by a Facebook user about Prime Minister Narendra Modi to be misleading.

title: Fact Check: Viral post on Raghuram Rajan, Rahul Gandhi and Nirav Modi is false
content: The Facebook post claims that Rajan had warned Rahul about the scam involving Nirav but he was asked to remain silent.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Wife divorced husband for faking as deaf and dumb is a fictitious story
content: India Today Anti Fake News War room (AFWA) has found this news to be completely false. 'World News Daily Report' is a Canadian website notorious for publishing fictitious stories.

title: Fact Check: Sambit Patra's photo with chowkidar chor hai poster is fake
content: The post has been uploaded by Facebook user Rajender Singh ,who has watermarked the picture with his initials "RDS". The post has been shared by 893 times till the filing of this story.

title: Fact Check: No, this is not IAF pilot Abhinandan's uniform at Pakistan museum
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the uniform in a viral picture is not Abhinandan's but it is the coverall (suit) of an Israeli pilot.

title: Fact Check: No, this London tea shop didn't use Abhinandan's image on its signboard
content: A photo is doing rounds on social media showing a sketch of Abhinandan on the signboard of a tea shop in London called 'Chaiiwala' but India Today Anti Fake News War Room found the viral photo is morphed.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Pakistan shows old, doctored video, claiming it an Indian submarine
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found that the claim made by Pakistan is misleading.

title: Fact Check: The woman in this viral picture is not IAF pilot Abhinandan's wife
content: India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) has found the claim to be totally false as the woman and the child in the picture is not Abhinandan's wife and son. We found that it is election strategist Prashant Kishor's wife Jahnavi Das and their son with PM Modi in this viral photo.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: Rahul Gandhi's claim on Ordnance factory of Amethi is misleading
content: A new war has erupted between Congress president Rahul Gandhi and Prime Minister Narendra Modi over Ordnance factory in Amethi.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check- PM stands correct, no bulletproof jacket procured during UPA-2
content: Taking a dig at the Opposition, PM Narendra Modi blamed that the UPA-2 regime for the lack of modernisation in the country's defence infrastructure while speaking at the India Today Conclave.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: This video showing celebration on the return of Abhinandan is fake
content: Amidst this, some self-proclaimed Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) members started sharing a video showing huge celebrations after the entry of Abhinandan in Indian border. India Today Anti Fake News War Room (AFWA) found that the video is morphed.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: False news again on Pakistan media, this time about retirement of Air Marshal Hari Kumar
content: Amid the ongoing tension between India and Pakistan, social media on both sides have become hyperactive. Pakistani media and its netizens have now claimed that Air Marshal Chandrashekharan Hari Kumar was sacked after the Indian Air Force lost several of its fighter aircraft to Pakistan in the recent standoff.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: No, it is not Wing Commander Abhinandan dancing with Pakistan Army
content: The videos claimed, "#Abhinandan dancing with the Army and Air Force in Pakistan. Soldiers Converted Battle Ground into Love for Each Other" as one Facebook user put it.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: False news again on Pakistan media, this time about the retirement of Air Marshal Hari Kumar
content: Tweets from the official Twitter handles of the IAF and Press Information Bureau have made it clear that Air Marshal Kumar retired on February 28 after serving 39 years in the Indian Air Force.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: Woman in this viral video is not the wife of IAF pilot Abhinandan Varthaman
content: A video, purportedly that of Abhinandan Varthman's wife is doing the rounds on social media. The video is fake.
author: Fact Check Bureau India Today

title: Fact Check: No, they are not the pilots who carried out air strikes on Pakistan
content: India Today found that misinformation is being spread online after Indian Air Force's raid across the Line of Control.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not a video of heavy firing in Pakistan but a gun event in US
content: A Facebook page called 'Voice of Pashtun' has posted a video of heavy firing, claiming it to be of "the current war going on in Pakistan's Sialkot region".
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: This is not the video of missing IAF pilot
content: The video that has surfaced shows an injured pilot lying on the ground and people trying to help him.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today

title: Fact Check: This shelling video has nothing to do with ongoing India-Pakistan conflict
content: On the basis of this video, it has been alleged that Pakistan was firing at India from across the Line of Control (LoC) in Sialkot in the early hours of Wednesday.
author: Nikhil Rampal India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video of IAF airstrike is actually from a video game
content: A video, which is being widely circulated on WhatsApp, Facebook and Twitter, shows how a fighter jet destroyed the camp.
author: Vidya  India Today

title: Fact Check: No, Harvard University did not give credit to 2019 Kumbh Mela over 2014 FIFA World Cup
content: The Harvard University report they are referring to is about the Maha Kumbh organised in 2013 and not the ongoing Ardh Kumbh Mela.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: Viral video claiming to be Rafale jet is actually a remote-controlled toy aircraft
content: India Today Anti Fake News War room (Afwa) found that the plane was not the Rafale fighter aircraft, but a remote-controlled turbine jet toy plane.
author: Chayan Kundu India Today

title: Fact Check: The viral video about bomb at Delhi metro was not a mock drill
content: DCP (Railways and Metro) Dinesh Kumar Gupta confirmed to India Today that somebody informed the police about suspicious elements near McDonald's but after the investigation, the police found some mobile batteries in a packet which didn't pose any threat.
author: Arjun Deodia India Today
